Position: Program Associate

SETU Nepal is a non-governmental organisation committed to the empowerment of vulnerable women and children, particularly those affected by HIV and GBV survivors. As part of its long-term vision for self-reliance and social impact, SETU Nepal is developing a sustainability program at Changunarayan, Bhaktapur. This space currently serves as a shelter and nurturing centre for orphaned children living with HIV and other vulnerable conditions, and is being transformed into a self-sustaining eco-village and tourism hub.

The program aims to generate income through eco-tourism and social enterprise, with all profits reinvested into the care, education, and livelihood of vulnerable children and youth with strong potential. We are seeking a child-friendly, compassionate, and visionary Program Associate to implement the project objective.

Duty Station: Changunarayan, Bhaktapur and Setu Nepal Office, Khumalatar, Lalitpur

Reports to: Program Officer

Working Hours: 09: 00 AM to 05:00 PM ( Monday to Friday)

Offered salary: NPR 25,000.00 – 28,000.00 per month ( Gross)

Key Responsibilities:

1. Program Implementation & Development

  • Assist in designing, implementing, and expanding eco-village and social enterprise activities aligned with SETU Nepal’s sustainability and livelihood goals.
  • Support the development of farming-based, eco-tourism, and hospitality initiatives that generate income and learning opportunities.
  • Assist in ensuring that the entire environment is safe, nurturing, and supportive of children and youth from vulnerable backgrounds.
  • Provide career guidance and basic counselling support to children and youth for identifying skill pathways and future opportunities.
  • Track activities, assess progress and impact, and prepare regular reports and documentation.

2. Partnership & Networking

  • Build and strengthen relationships with government bodies, NGOs/INGOs, vocational training institutes, corporate donors, and development partners.
  • Assist in fundraising initiatives and coordinate with well-wishers and supporters for financial and technical contributions.
  • Contribute to marketing and promotion strategies for organic products, eco-tourism experiences, and social enterprise initiatives (including digital platforms).

3. Community Engagement

  • Involve local youth, women, and other stakeholders in planning, training, and enterprise activities.
  • Promote inclusion and participation of marginalized groups.
  • Encourage local ownership of the program through active consultation and feedback.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree/Recently graduated in Management, Development Studies, Social Work, Environmental Science, Rural Development, Sustainable Tourism, Psychology, or related fields.
  • Strong communication skills in both Nepali and English.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with and support children and youth from vulnerable backgrounds.
  • Preferably experienced or trained in career counselling or youth guidance.
  • Ability to work independently in rural field settings with diverse teams.
  • Willingness and availability to work full-time.
  • Two-wheel driving license preferred.

Desirable Attributes

  • Familiarity with eco-tourism, sustainable enterprise, and social entrepreneurship.
  • Knowledge of marketing analysis, digital marketing for promoting organic and community-based products.
  • Child-friendly approach, with empathy, patience, and commitment to holistic development.
  • Knowledge in youth career counselling, guidance, or psychosocial support.
  • Passion for social justice, environmental sustainability, and innovation.
  • Strong networking skills and ability to engage supporters and donors.

Interested Nepali citizens who meet the above criteria are encouraged to apply with a curriculum vitae and cover letter showing their interest, including mailing address and telephone number, along with two references to Executive Director by 11th January,2026, to info@setunepal.org.np

Telephone enquiries will not be entertained. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for further screening. SETU Nepal reserves the right to reject any or all applications without assigning any reasons.

SETU Nepal promotes workforce diversity and applies positive discrimination to the candidates from socially excluded groups. Applications from and members of indigenous, disadvantaged and sexual minority groups are highly encouraged.

(“SETU Nepal is committed to safeguarding and a zero-tolerance organization related to child abuse, corruption, bribery, fraud etc.”)

Position: Executive Director

1. Background

YKP LEAD Nepal is a youth-led national

l organization working with Young Key Populations (YKPs) and Young People Living with HIV (YPLHIVs). The organization focuses on youth leadership development, HIV care and support, advocacy, stigma reduction, community empowerment, and rights-based programming.
To ensure effective leadership, compliance, program quality, and organizational sustainability, YKP LEAD Nepal seeks to appoint a qualified Executive Director (ED) to lead the organization in line with its mission, policies, and statutory obligations.

2. Position Summary

The Executive Director (ED) is the chief executive officer of the organization and is responsible for the overall management, leadership, coordination, and representation of YKP LEAD Nepal. The ED reports directly to the Board and is accountable for program implementation, financial management, human resources, donor compliance, and institutional development.

3. Scope of Work and Responsibilities

The Executive Director shall perform the following duties:

3.1 Organizational Leadership and Management

  • Provide strategic leadership and direction in line with the organization’s vision, mission, and objectives
  • Ensure effective day-to-day management of organizational operations
  • Lead and supervise staff, consultants, and volunteers
  • Ensure the implementation of organizational policies, procedures, and internal control systems

3.2 Program Planning and Implementation

  • Oversee planning, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of programs and projects
  • Ensure quality, timely, and results-based program delivery
  • Ensure integration of gender, inclusion, safeguarding, and rights-based approaches in all programs

3.3 Financial Management and Administration

  • Oversee financial planning, budgeting, and expenditure control in coordination with the Finance/Admin function and Board
  • Ensure compliance with donor requirements, SWC regulations, and Government of Nepal policies
  • Ensure timely audits, financial reporting, and transparency

3.4 Donor Coordination and Resource Mobilization

  • Lead donor engagement, communication, and relationship management
  • Coordinate proposal development, donor reporting, and grant compliance
  • Support resource mobilization and organizational sustainability initiatives

3.5 Governance and Compliance

  • Act as the primary liaison between the organization and the Board
  • Support Board meetings, reporting, and decision-making processes
  • Ensure compliance with SWC, line ministries, and other statutory requirements
  • Represent the organization in official coordination and review meetings

3.6 Representation, Advocacy, and Networking

  • Represent YKP LEAD Nepal at national, regional, and international forums
  • Strengthen coordination with government agencies, donors, networks, and civil society organizations
  • Lead advocacy initiatives related to youth, HIV, key populations, and social justice

4. Required Qualifications and Experience

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Social Sciences, Public Health, Development Studies,
  • Management, or a related field
  • Minimum 2-3 years of experience in leadership or senior management roles in NGOs/INGOs or
  • networks, with experience working with YPLHIVs and YKPs
  • Demonstrated understanding of HIV programming, youth-led approaches, key populations, and rights-based frameworks
  • Proven experience in donor coordination, proposal development, and project reporting
  • Strong leadership, organizational management, and team supervision skills
  • Excellent written and spoken English and Nepali
  • The candidate must be from within key population / YPLHIV community

How to Apply:
Interested candidates should submit:
-Updated CV
-Cover letter
Email: ykap.nepal@gmail.com
Subject: Application: Executive Director

Company Overview

Organization Name: eSewa

Location: Pulchowk, Lalitpur District, Nepal

Website: https://esewa.com.np/

The Event Coordinator is responsible for planning, coordinating, and executing eSewa’s onboarding, merchant, promotional, and corporate events while ensuring strong brand visibility and policy compliance. The role manages end-to-end event operations, stakeholder coordination, on-ground execution, and post-event reporting to support business and merchant growth.

Qualification and Experience

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Management, Business Administration, Marketing, Event Management, or a related field.
  •  Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in event management, coordination, or brand activation
  •  Experience in fintech, corporate events, or merchant-focused programs will be an added advantage

Job Description

  • Act as the focal person for all eSewa event planning, execution, and closure
  •  Plan, coordinate, and conduct onboarding, merchant engagement, promotional, and corporate events
  • Manage end-to-end event operations, including logistics, vendors, timelines, and on-ground execution
  • Ensure consistent brand visibility and representation of eSewa across all events
  • Coordinate with internal teams and external partners for seamless event delivery
  • Build and maintain healthy working relationships with existing and potential merchants through events
  • Support strategic event planning aimed at revenue generation and merchant acquisition
  • Handle on-ground challenges and conflict resolution during events professionally
  • Ensure all event activities comply with company policies, ethical standards, and brand guidelines
  • Prepare post-event reports, documentation, and improvement recommendations

Required Skills

  • Strong event planning, coordination, and execution capabilities
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Ability to manage multiple events and work under pressure
  • Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
  • Strategic thinking with attention to brand visibility and business impact
  • High attention to detail and strong organizational skills
  • Professional integrity and adherence to company values

Benefits of Working at eSewa

  •  Stellar opportunity to work with a rising company
  • The amazing and passionate young team, beautiful office space
  • Trust of the biggest FinTech company.
  •  One-of-a-kind company culture and growth opportunities to accelerate your career progression.

How to apply?

We are always keen to meet energetic and talented professionals who would like to join our team. Click on the button below and submit your application to apply for the post.

title.rendered: Project Coordinator, MERL & Knowledge Management Officer, Admin and Finance Officer, Field Supervisor

content.rendered:
Samagra Jan Utthan Kendra (All People’s Development Center, APEC) is a non-profitable social development & humanitarian organization. APEC was legally established in 2002 A.D. by an intellectual and youth group in Lahan, Siraha, Nepal. The organization’s main vision is to create a society that upholds human rights and justice for all through peaceful and cooperative social mobilization. APEC’s mission is to promote the establishment of an equitable, self-reliant, and developed peaceful society where everyone has equal access to opportunities and human rights. APEC has been working on human right protection, civil peace service, transitional justice initiatives, GBV reduction initiatives, security & justice promotion, adolescent development, resilient development, Public Service Awareness in partnership with local government and different funding partners since its establishment in Madhesh Province. The organization works to strengthen both community demand and service providers’ supply to address the voices of marginalized and deprived communities, eliminate economic exclusion and social discrimination, strengthen human rights, increase access to justice, and promote civic engagement for inclusive development.

Samagra Jan Utthan Kendra has announced the vacancy for the below positions for qualified, dynamic, and motivated Nepali citizen under “Bright future: Empowered Children, Adolescents and Youths (CAY)” project supported by the Plan International Nepal, is designed to enhance Adolescent and young people especially Young women are empowered to break the cycle of child marriage and poverty to enjoy their rights. The project is implementing in Siraha district.

NOTE: These all positions are Subject to contingent upon the availability of funds.

Job Title: Project Coordinator
No. of Vacancy: 1
Reports to: Executive Director/ Project Specialist Plan International Nepal
Supervises: MERL & Knowledge Management Officer, Field Supervisor, Project Staff.
Duty Station: APEC Office (with travel as required)

Purpose of the Position

To provide overall leadership, coordination, and management of the “Bright Future” project, ensuring effective implementation of activities aimed at empowering adolescents and youth-especially girls and young women-to challenge child, early and forced marriage (CEFM) and improve economic opportunities.

Major roles and responsibilities:

A. Program Management

  • Develop a project operational calendar highlighting key milestones and financial projections
  • Conduct market assessments, and opportunity mapping to identify viable enterprise and skills options for young people especially young women in project area.
  • Identify project participants as per criteria of the project.
  • Assessment and maintain harmony to private service provider and market driver for linkages and resource leverage to youth and women entrepreneurs.
  • Facilitate access to grants, seed funding, and youth-friendly financial services.
  • Ensure program quality implementation and achieve good result
  • Ensure to include cross-cutting themes to contribute to project goal
  • Identifying potential risks, developing mitigation strategies, and effective risk management in place

A strong financial and supply chain management leadership to manage projects effectively and stewardship principles adhere well.

  • Facilitate meaningful engagement and mobilization of private-sector actors in enterprise development initiatives.
  • Connect enterprises to lead firms, cooperatives, aggregators, suppliers, and buyers.
  • Identify and broker partnerships with local market actors, BFIs/MFIs, cooperatives, chambers of commerce, and business service providers.
  • Support linking youth businesses to digital marketplaces and e-commerce channels.
  • Facilitate networking, peer-learning, and knowledge-sharing among youth-led enterprises.
  • Ensure timely, efficient, and quality delivery of planned activities in line with approved plans and budgets.
  • Lead planning, implementation, and monitoring of all project activities in line with approved work plans and budgets.
  • Ensure project outcomes related to social norm change and youth economic empowerment are achieved.

B. Team management and Capacity building

  • Support implementing partner and respective local government for regular monitoring providing technical support.
  • Coordinate and support for joint monitoring of local stakeholders and political leaders as applicable.
  • Lead the team to manage the provided resources in an efficient and responsible manner
  • Guide the team in achieving community empowerment and promote sustainability drivers.
  • Demonstrate strong leadership to coach, mentor, and guide the team in delivering their plan/tasks
  • Conduct regular capacity assessments of the project team and provide needful support to demonstrate better leadership
  • Support team in best utilizing the provided digital platforms to input correct data and regular review and analysis of the data and information
  • Strongly lead the team in maintaining integrity in data and information management
  • Manage effective communication and coordination with staff, local government, and funding partners as well.
  • Capacity building of team and delivery different soft skills trainings in the community

C. Coordination and Collaboration

  • Collaborate with TVET schools/institutions, industries, Technical Training Providers (TTPs) to run market driven and practical skills development trainings.
  • Coordinate with stakeholders like Child right committee, child club, municipalities, DCC, AKC, TTPs, Cottage industries, CTEVT, ministries, private sectors along with Child Networks,
  • Coordinate with Local government to review policies, guideline and budget allocation based on Ending child marriage strategy of Nepal’s government
  • Build network with likeminded organizations, networks, government agencies working in the sector of livelihood and child marriage to promote resource sharing at palika/district/province level.
  • Organize stakeholder meeting, share the project progress and collect feedback throughout the project cycle
  • Represent project in different forums and collaborate accordingly in common issues.
  • Lead planning, implementation, and monitoring of all project activities in line with approved work plans and budgets.
  • Ensure project outcomes related to social norm change and youth economic empowerment are achieved.
  • Ensuring effective delivery of activities agreed to achieve the result.
  • Ensure budget expenditure in cost effective way follow up financial rules and regulations of organization.
  • Diligently perform duties assigned by the organization in support of institutional campaigns.

D. Monitoring Evaluation, Reporting and Documentation

  • Conduct field visit and provide support to team accordingly to effectively implementation.
  • Ensure quality program deliverance in coordination with subordinates and Plan International Nepal.
  • Prepare Periodic Reports as per compliance and requirements.
  • Prepare case stories and documentation of project’s challenges and learnings.
  • Accept and do other responsibility as per the need of project and organizations.
  • Prepare monthly, quarterly progress report, database, event report.
  • Ensure timely and quality narrative and donor reports.
  • Work closely with MERL Coordinator to use data for adaptive programming.
  • Ensure safeguarding, accountability, and inclusion standards are upheld.

E. Communication

  • Maintain regular working relationships with local level and Stakeholders.
  • Maintain clear and specific communication strategies of project implementation to relevant.
  • Undertake any other relevant responsibilities assigned by APEC.

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Master’s Degree in the given sector, management, social science, or Development Studies, or related field.
  • 5 years of working experience in TVET, Enterprise Development, Livelihood, Private Sector Engagement and humanitarian projects.
  • Work base learning, on farm and off farm enterprise, climate sensitive livelihood (Vocational) Strong coordination skill, report writing, and facilitation skills.

Job Title: MERL & Knowledge Management Officer
No. of Vacancy: 1

Reports to: Project Coordinator

Duty Station: APEC Office (with field visits)

Purpose of the Position

To design and manage Monitoring, Evaluation, Research, Learning (MERL), and knowledge management systems that track progress, measure impact, and promote learning across the project.

Major roles and responsibilities:

A. MONITORING

  • Support to update project participants’ information regularly in an online system (developed by Plan International Nepal) to track all project beneficiaries
  • Monitor project activities, and produce and submit a monthly report
  • Carry out the regular monitoring and provide the feedback in time to project team
  • Carry out the quality outcome and quality monitoring and submit reports
  • Prepare human centric case story, develop project impact videos and capture good photos
  • Perform regular field visits to ensure the quality of data collected by project/program staff and verify the accuracy of reported data
  • Maintain project database including relevant documents and reports
  • Support in income and employment verification of project participants
  • Support and facilitate project related surveys, studies and assessments
  • Support the project team to ensure accountability and Safeguarding Children and Young People (SCYP)
  • Develop learning log sheet and update regularly
  • Work closely with MERL team of Plan International Nepal and perform the act as per need

B. EVALUATIONS

  • Collect and collate secondary data from various sources in working districts and municipalities for the purpose of assessments, baseline surveys, and evaluations- as per the requirement of Plan International Nepal
  • Take the lead role in coordination, communication, and getting necessary approval from local government authorities regarding baseline surveys, evaluations, and special research/studies
  • Provide necessary information to the project team during the time of DPAC (district project advisory committee) meeting.
  • Support project teams to draw key learning, good practices, and significant case stories from and share with senior management of the organization as well as Plan International Nepal.
  • Prepare monthly, quarterly report, database, event report.
  • Ensure timely and quality donor reports.

C. Learning & Adaptive Management

  • Facilitate reflection and learning sessions with project staff and stakeholders.
  • Support evidence-based decision-making and adaptive programming.

D. Knowledge Management

  • Document best practices, success stories, case studies, and lessons learned.
  • Support knowledge sharing with partners, donors, and communities.

E. Data Quality & Reporting

  • Ensure data quality, ethical standards, and confidentiality—especially when working with adolescents.
  • Contribute to donor reports with strong evidence and analysis.

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in social science/ development studies/ statistics or related field (Master’s preferred).
  • Social works in the field relevant to M&E At least 3 years of experience working with I/NGO in the field of monitoring, evaluation, and accountability including depth knowledge of the GESI sector.
  • Strong data analysis, report writing, and facilitation skills.

Job Title: Admin and Finance Officer

No. of Vacancy: 1

Reports to: Project Coordinator

Duty Station: APEC Office

Purpose of the Position

To ensure efficient financial management, administrative support, and compliance with organizational and donor policies for the project.

Major roles and responsibilities:

A. Financial Management

  • Prepare, review, and monitor project budgets in coordination with Program Coordinator and Executive Director.
  • Responsible for accounting of all incoming and outgoing financial transactions and ensure all the payments are made following proper financial procedures.
  • Review and check all the financial documents, bills and supporting documents before submitting administrative and program expense statements, making payments to the employees and other third parties
  • Maintain accurate financial records, vouchers, and documentation for all project expenditures.
  • Process payments, reimbursements, and ensure timely salary disbursement to staff.
  • Monitor and report on budget utilization and variances regularly.
  • Ensure compliance with organizational financial policies and donor guidelines.
  • Assist in internal and external audits and provide required documents.
  • Track the Issuance and settlement of employee advance and ensure all the advance are settled timely.
  • Create and update the cost sharing table amongst projects, and ensure that all office expenditures are allocated fairly and consistently among all of the available projects.

B. Administrative Management

  • Maintain official project records, correspondences, and documentation.
  • Ensure proper filing and documentation of contracts, agreements, and administrative records.
  • Support logistics arrangements for meetings, workshops, and training sessions.
  • Maintain inventory of office and project assets, and ensure proper utilization and safeguarding.

C. Reporting

  • Produce monthly financial reports package reviewing bank reconciliation, accounts payables & receivables and ensure that spending is done in-line with approved budget.
  • Prepare cashflow (liquidation plan) by coordinating with program coordinator and request fund transfer to ensure adequate supply of funds. Participate in establishing procedures and forms for request and the issue of funds for program needs.
  • Provide financial analysis to the project lead including the board with burn rate and phasing.
  • It is the is the responsibility to make sure that all financial documents are kept safe and secure moreover maintain an external backup of all financial data on a regular basis.
  • Provide timely financial updates to Program coordinator, Executive Director and donor as required.
  • Maintain transparency in all financial and administrative processes.

D. Procurement and Compliance

  • Manage procurement processes following organizational policies.
  • Ensure compliance with financial, HR, and administrative guidelines.
  • Maintain contracts and agreements with suppliers and service providers.
  • Preparation and administration of payroll adhering to the required compliance.
  • Support and act as finance representative for procurement committee to prepare procurement plan and facilitate to perform procurement process adhering procurement policies and guideline.
  • Be familiar with and are updated on partnership compliance, Local/National Laws and Tax regulations of the Government of Nepal.

E. Coordination

  • Liaise with partner organizations, local government, and relevant stakeholders regarding financial and administrative matters.
  • Support project staff in financial and administrative queries.
    Provide guidance on finance-related procedures to field staff.
  • Any transactions that are doubtful or suspicious (by employees, organization, or other linked parties) should be reported through the adequate reporting channel.

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Bachelor’s Degree of Commerce, Business Studies or Equivalent or Master’s Degree in Finance/Accounting.
  • Equivalent, preferred Minimum 3 years of experience in independently handling budgeting, financial accounting, planning, analysis, Procurement Management/Finance/ Office Administration in I/NGO and preferably within the Plan’s project.

Job Title: Field Supervisors (Protection)

No. of Vacancy: 1

Reports to: Project Coordinator

Duty Station: Working Municipality field area.

Purpose of the Position

To oversee day-to-day field implementation of project activities, ensuring meaningful participation of adolescents, youth, families, and communities in efforts to prevent CEFM and promote economic empowerment.

Major roles and responsibilities:

  • Prepare, compulsorily, the monthly action plan of the allocated program, take approval from the project coordinator and accomplish the project accordingly.
  • Facilitate and provide Protection related training and aware on Positive Parenting, Child Protection and youth related issues.
  • Formation of Adolescent club in coordination with local government and support in the campaign led by the club.
  • Organize awareness raising activities/orientations to prevent child marriage.
  • Encourage/ensure active participation of adolescents and youths in campaigns. Facilitate dialogue between youth, adolescent’s community leaders, social /religious leaders to end child marriage
  • Work closely with local government to declare child marriage free palika /ward
  • Collect and document successful stories, data of project participants/beneficiaries.
  • Advocate for the need of program and budget to act against child, early and force marriage with local government through local level planning process.
  • Support in implementation of Project with quality and timely completion.
  • Ensure safe, inclusive, and youth-friendly spaces for adolescents and young people.
  • Support collective actions and community-led initiatives against harmful norms.
  • Identify and mobilize the resources relating to enterprises in Coordination with Palika and PC.
  • Inform, written or verbally with reasons, the project coordinator if any unfavorable situation occurred during the course of the implementation of the proposed program.
  • Keep a record and provide a record to the project coordinator about every project in the respected area of child protection.
  • Conduct each and every allocated project and training in the respective area as per the approved plan.
  • Routinely submit a monthly work progress report and field report of the respective duty station to the project coordinator.
  • Collect field data and reports in coordination with the MERL Coordinator.
  • Identify challenges, risks, and success stories from the field.
  • Ensure child and youth safeguarding policies are followed at all times.
  • Report and respond appropriately to protection concerns.

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Intermediate level in Social Science and related faculty.
  • 3 years of work in Child Protection and Social Protection or related work(Competent candidates from local areas will be highly prioritized.
  • Strong facilitation, communication, and problem-solving skills.
  • Experience addressing CEFM or gender norms is an advantage.

Job Title: Field Supervisor (Livelihood)

No. of Vacancy: 1

Reports to: Project Coordinator

Duty Station: Working Municipality (Field area)

Major roles and responsibilities:

  • Prepare, compulsorily, the monthly action plan of the allocated program, take approval from the project coordinator and accomplish the project accordingly.
  • Support selection of young people for the soft skills and vocational skills development trainings.
  • Facilitate Life skills trainings
  • Facilitate for preparation of Business Plan of every training participant and regular follow up of progress
  • Provide hands-on support in business planning, bookkeeping, and troubleshooting.
  • Link project participants with buyers, suppliers, cooperatives, and traders.
  • Support to link project participants with employers for the job placement.
  • Identify and mobilize the resources relating to enterprises
  • Update regular income tracking of all employed and self-employed young people. Coordinate with local level stakeholder i.e. Palika, micro enterprise development unit, social development unit, TTPs and other as per need.
  • Facilitate the Micro Enterprise Development Training/ Start and Improve Your Business- TOPE/TOSE/TOEE/TOGE training
  • Regular follow up and home visit of project participants
  • Career counselling and motivation for ME and VTs
  • Inform, written or verbally with reasons, the project coordinator if any unfavorable situation occurred during the course of the implementation of the proposed program.
  • Keep a record and provide a record to the project coordinator about every project in the respected area of child protection.
  • Conduct each and every allocated project and training in the respective area as per the approved plan.
  • Routinely submit a monthly work progress report and field report of the respective duty station to the project coordinator.
  • Formation of Adolescent club in coordination with local government and support in the campaign led by the club.
  • Organize awareness raising activities/orientations to prevent child marriage.
  • Encourage/ensure active participation of adolescents and youths in campaigns.
  • Facilitate dialogue between youth, adolescents, community leaders, social /religious leaders to end child marriage
  • Work closely with local government to declare child marriage free palika /ward
  • Collect and document successful stories, data of project participants/beneficiaries.
  • Advocate for the need of program and budget to act against child, early and force marriage with local government through local level planning process.

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Enterprise Development studies/JT/JTA intermediate.
  • 3 years of work in TVET and Enterprise Development Sector (on the farm and off-farm) and Protection. (Competent candidates from local areas will be highly prioritized.
  • Strong facilitation, communication, and problem-solving skills.

Application Information

Interested candidates who meet these criteria should apply to vacancy.samagra@gmail.com and submit their updated CV and application including at least current two references and a scan copy of Nepali Citizenship before 7th January, 2026 at 05:00 PM.

Note:

  • Samagra Jan Utthan Kendra adheres Safeguarding Policy.

  • 2 wheelers license holders are encouraged to apply

No telephone calls will be entertained. SAMAGRA reserves the right to reject any or all applications without assigning any reasons whatsoever.
  • APEC does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruitment process.
  • All positions are contingent and will be based on funding availability from donor agency.
  • Salary and other benefits as for organization policy.

title.rendered: Call for Applications – Consultants / Service Providers

content.rendered:
About Us 

For the Youth • By the Youth • Led by the Youth

YKP LEAD Nepal, a youth-led organization working  for Young People Living with HIV (YPLHIV) and Young Key Populations (YKPs). It is a youth-led organization dedicated to advancing the rights and well-being of Young People Living with HIV (YPLHIV) and Young Key Populations (YKPs) in Nepal. We drive change through advocacy, capacity building, and community-led initiatives.

Call for Experts

We are expanding our Consultant Roster and invite energetic, skilled professionals to support our youth-focused program.Apply for one or multiple roles matching your expertise.We invite expressions of interest from experienced professionals with proven expertise. Selected consultants will deliver specialized short-term assignments.

Scope of Services

  1. “Know Your Rights” and legal literacy district-level training
    Design, Facilitate and document legal literacy training.
  2. Advocacy on abroad employment and study
    Document ,Facilitate workshop on overseas employment options, processes, and rights for YPLHIVs.
  3. Training on organizational development & advocacy skills for YKPs
    Develop, document  and conduct capacity-building training for YKP LEAD Nepal  and community stakeholders .
  4. Website development and renewal
    Design, update, and modernize the YKP LEAD Nepal website with improved functionality.
  5. National consultation of YKP LEAD Nepal.
    Facilitate and document a national consultation workshop, ensuring broad participation.
  6. Human Rights Day observation
    Plan and execute activities leading up to Human Rights Day .

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Minimum 3–5 years of professional experience in one or more of the above thematic areas.
  • Demonstrated expertise working with youth, PLHIV, KPs, and community-led approaches.
  • Proven ability to design and deliver high-quality training, research, advocacy, or policy support.
  • Excellent facilitation, communication, and documentation skills.
  • Strong commitment to health rights, gender equality, inclusion, and stigma reduction.

Application Procedure:

Interested individuals are requested to submit their applications by email with the following documents:

Submit applications to:ykap.nepal@gmail.com
Subject Line:Application: [Specify the consultancy role(s) you are applying for]
(Example: Application: Legal Literacy Training Consultant)

Required Documents:

  1. Letter of Interest specifying the program area(s) of expertise.
  2. Updated CV with relevant experience.
  3. At least one sample of relevant previous work (e.g., training material, report, policy brief).
  4. Firm registration and renewal and PAN/VAT registration with  tax clearance (if applicable)

Note: Qualified and shortlisted applicants will be included in YKP LEAD Nepal’s consultant roster and contacted as per project needs for long-term and short-term assignments, consultancies, and trainings.

UN Women-Communications Associate, Kathmandu, Nepal, N-PPSA-7, National Partner Personnel Services Agreement

Job Info

Job Identification: 31068
Apply Before: 01/17/2026, 04:15 AM
Job Schedule: Full time
Locations: Nepal
Job Function: Communications and Advocacy
Initial Contract Duration: 12
Vacancy Category: Local Opportunities

Job Description

Background:

UN Women, grounded in the vision of equality enshrined in the Charter of the United Nations, works for the elimination of discrimination against women and girls; the empowerment of women; and the achievement of equality between women and men as partners and beneficiaries of development, human rights, humanitarian action, and peace and security.

Reporting to the Head of the Communications, the Communications Associate supports the formulation and implementation of the communications and advocacy strategies to increase the outreach, standing, and awareness of UN Women with partners, the media, and the public in line with corporate communications policies and initiatives. The Communications Associate adopts a quality and client-oriented approach to deliver results and also support activities and special events organized by UN Women.

Scope of Work:

Provide coordination support in NCO’s communication planning, campaign coordination, and digital content development:

  • Provide substantive inputs to the development of the NCO’s advocacy and communication strategy.
  • Provide support to advocacy efforts and campaigns by conceptualizing and developing campaign frameworks with clear objectives, key messages, audiences, and timelines.
  • Coordinate implementation of campaign activities, ensuring strong digital amplification and cross-platform integration for UN Women/UN system observances and thematic campaigns such as International Women’s Day, 16 Days of Activism, women’s political participation, women’s economic empowerment, and the care economy etc.
  • Develop social media content and digital assets (graphics, copy, reels, animations, short videos, etc.) aligned with campaign and programmatic priorities, requiring proficiency in Canva and Adobe Creative Suite tools, including Premiere Pro, Illustrator, and InDesign or other software with equivalent capabilities.
  • Provide or coordinate the development of campaign narratives, programme briefs, briefs to capture the results of NCO, and other advocacy materials that support UN Women’s communication objectives.
  • Develop and maintain weekly digital content calendars for effective planning and implementation of the social media posting plan.
  • Provide guidance and support to programme and other NCO’s staff on UN Women corporate communications guidelines and printing norms to ensure it complies with corporate branding, accessibility standards, and visibility guidelines from HQ and RO.
  • Provide support to translate, adapt, and redesign NCO’s materials for broader reach.
  • Provide analysis and insights to social media trends, platform performance, and audience engagement; track campaign progress and prepare analytics reports, updates, and end-line summaries with recommendations.

Provide substantive support to manage and expand the NCO’s web, media, and social media/digital presence

  • Identify stories and achievements within the NCO and develop/review content for the NCO’s website hosted at the RO and social media channels including for the publications.
  • Maintain and regularly update the NCO website content in accordance with corporate requirements in coordination with the Communications Officer.
  • Prepare press releases, articles, key messages, and other advocacy materials and support for roundtable discussions, press conferences, and other publicity events, and prepare briefing materials and press releases.
  • Manage NCO social media platforms, ensuring strategic scheduling, timely engagement, and adherence to corporate social media policy.
  • Upload stories, resources, and campaign materials to internal knowledge management systems and external platforms.
  • Introduce and test innovative digital formats to enhance reach, engagement, and audience diversity.
  • Provide support to the Communication Officer to liaise with media to establish and maintain relationships with them; maintain and update database of relevant media and media person, as necessary;
  • Respond to requests for information and arrange interviews; and
  • Draft talking points.
  • Maintain library/ database of reference materials and photos, and digital assets, as necessary;
  • Provide support on special web/digital/media projects undertaken by the NCO.
  • Research, compile, and produce reports on web statistics regularly and electronic surveys.
  • Maintain files, databases, and systems relevant to the NCO’s digital presence, as necessary; and
  • Follow guidelines from RO/HQ.

Facilitate knowledge management, building, sharing, and digital learning:

  • Contribute to the identification of best practices and lessons learned.
  • Support to conduct trainings and workshops on communication practices, digital communication, campaign planning, and social media innovation.
  • Maintain a structured repository of communication materials, campaign assets, templates, and multimedia resources; regularly upload photos to Flickr.
  • Provide inputs to quarterly and annual reporting, including communications metrics, campaign summaries, and digital outreach analysis.
  • Provide/ exchange information with HQ and RO, NCO, and COs.

Maintain and Coordinate Communications Consultants:

  • Support the coordination and management of communications consultants, including work planning, deliverable tracking, and timeline monitoring.
  • Review consultants’ outputs for quality, alignment with UN Women standards, and timely delivery, in coordination with the Communications Officer.
  • Support administrative processes related to consultants, including onboarding, contract follow-up, and coordination with program support team members.
  • Track consultants’ time and deliverables and ensure certification of satisfactory completion to facilitate timely payments, in line with UN Women procedures.
  • The incumbent performs other duties within their functional profile as deemed necessary for the efficient functioning of the Office and the Organization

Competencies :

Core Values:

  • Integrity;
  • Professionalism;
  • Respect for Diversity.

Core Competencies:

  • Awareness and Sensitivity Regarding Gender Issues;
  • Accountability;
  • Creative Problem Solving;
  • Effective Communication;
  • Inclusive Collaboration;
  • Stakeholder Engagement;
  • Leading by Example.

Please visit this link for more information on UN Women’s Values and Competencies Framework:

Functional Competencies:

  • Ability to design and support strategic digital communication and advocacy initiatives with a gender perspective
  • Strong skills in planning and coordinating digital advocacy campaigns across multiple platforms
  • Excellent knowledge of social media and communications strategy and methods with an ability to produce high-quality social media and digital content (graphics, reels, videos, photos)
  • Proficient in Canva and Adobe Creative Suite tools, including Premiere Pro, Illustrator, and InDesign, or other software with equivalent capabilities, for video, audio, and graphic design editing.
  • Knowledge of branding, accessibility, and corporate visibility standards
  • Ability to monitor social media performance and provide data-driven analysis, and a strong understanding of social media platforms, scheduling tools, and community engagement
  • Ability to introduce innovative digital formats to enhance outreach
  • Strong storytelling, communication, and advocacy skills to identify relevant events and stories and communicate and advocate them to a mass audience
  • Ability to document and share lessons learned and manage communication repositories
  • Ability to support training on digital communication and campaign management
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills for reporting and content management
  • Ability to establish, build, and sustain effective relationships with clients
  • Ability to create, edit, and present information in clear and presentable formats, using appropriate IT functionality
  • Excellent event planning skills
  • Strong multimedia skills
  • Knowledge of gender equality and women’s empowerment

Minimum Qualifications:

Education and Certification: Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in communications, journalism, or a relevant field is required.

Experience: At least 7 years of progressively responsible experience in providing support to the formulation and implementation of internal and external communications and advocacy strategies and related plans is required.

  • Experience in the use of social media, basic video recording/editing, graphic designing and digital communications is required.
  • Experience in the usage of computers and office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc.) and spreadsheet and database packages, experience in handling of web-based management systems is required.
  • Experience in the use of a modern web-based ERP System, preferably Oracle Cloud, is desirable.

Languages

  • Fluency in English is required.
  • Fluency in [Nepali] is required.
  • Knowledge of another official UN language is desirable (French, Arabic, Chinese, Russian or Spanish).

Statements :

In July 2010, the United Nations General Assembly created UN Women, the United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women. The creation of UN Women came about as part of the UN reform agenda, bringing together resources and mandates for greater impact. It merges and builds on the important work of four previously distinct parts of the UN system (DAW, OSAGI, INSTRAW and UNIFEM), which focused exclusively on gender equality and women’s empowerment.

Diversity and inclusion:

At UN Women, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment of mutual respect. UN Women recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, ability, national origin, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, competence, integrity and organizational need.

If you need any reasonable accommodation to support your participation in the recruitment and selection process, please direct your request and inquiries to hr.nepal@unwomen.org and also include this information in your application.

UN Women has a zero-tolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UN Women, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to UN Women’s policies and procedures and the standards of conduct expected of UN Women personnel and will therefore undergo rigorous reference and background checks. (Background checks will include the verification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information to conduct a background check.)

Applicants must ensure that all sections of the application form, including the sections on education and employment history, are completed. If all sections are not completed the application may be disqualified from the recruitment and selection process.

Informal Sector Service Centre (INSEC) established in 1989 with the objective of protecting and promoting human rights and social justice in Nepal, requires application for the post of Finance Assistant Officer. Eligible and interested candidates are requested to apply as per the announcement.

Position: Finance Officer based in Kathmandu Central Office.

Required number: 1

Required Qualification, Experience and Knowledge:

  • Master’s Degree in Finance, Business Studies, or Accounting.
  • Two years of working experience in related field.
  • Good interpersonal and time management skills.
  • Knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting skills.

Responsibilities

  • Support the Finance and Admin Manager in book keeping and track the day-to-day finances.
  • Review all the supporting documents of the vouchers to ensure they are justifiable and in line with the approved budget.
  • Complete bank reconciliation on a monthly basis.
  • Maintain financial records and files.
  • Collect information and documentation related to finance, administration, and logistics.
  • Assist auditors in carrying out internal and external audits.
  • Support in other admin-related office work assigned by Finance Officer, Management Head, and Executive Director.
  • Additional responsibilities will be assigned as per the requirements.

Position: Assistant Documentation Officer for Central Office

Required number: 1

Qualification: Bachelor’s Degree in English, Human Rights, Law, Journalism or equivalent with minimum three years’ experience in human rights documentation.

The Documentation Officer is responsible to ensure the validity and reliability of human rights violation or abuse data or cases from the respective provinces. Similarly, they should have to demonstrate the skills and knowledge for editing the content to publish in INSECOnline and the Nepal Human Rights Year Book.

Asst. Documentation Officer under the supervision of concerned authorities at the central office and Province Coordinator will ensure proper documentation of data and reports in Nepali and English language. They should be easy going and willing to work under time pressure. The Documentation Officer must have fundamental knowledge on The Constitution of Nepal, human rights, law, and social justice.

Note: Applicants are requested to send their application along with a curriculum vitae and a cover letter by Jan 10, 2026, to vacancy@insec.org.np. Telephone inquiries will not be entertained. Only short-listed candidates will be called for written test and interview.

Justice and Rights Institute – Nepal (JuRI Nepal), established in 2011 working as a non-profit organization and responds to the existing and emerging human rights, accountability and good governance concerns, upholding the principles of human rights, gender equality, cherishing diversity, advocating zero-tolerance of any violence, discrimination and corruption, works independence of any political influence and corporate interest. It brings together human rights professionals with an extensive experience in human rights, the rule of law, gender, inclusion, disability, and social justice. JuRI-Nepal aims to create a fair, just, and inclusive democratic society where everyone can enjoy their human rights.

JuRI- Nepal is collaborating with UNFPA as a National Implementing Partner in the execution of the 9th Country Programme Document 2023-2027. The project aims to support promoting gender equality and Sexual and Reproductive Health Rights, respond GBV, and support strengthening gender-responsive governance. Under this project, we are looking for a potential Nepalese candidate to fill the position.

JuRI -Nepal hereby invites applications for the below-mentioned position, from interested professionals.

Position: Monitoring and Evaluation Officer – 1 (Part Time – 80%)

Duty Station: JuRI-Nepal Office, Jwagal Lalitpur with frequent visits to the project locations.

Duration: 5.5 months (extension depends on availability of fund)

Required qualifications and experience:

  • Master’s degree in social sciences, information and knowledge management, communications, or a related technical field;
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience in development planning, information and knowledge management, research and/or evaluation;
  • Demonstrable ability to conceptualize, plan and execute ideas as well as transfer knowledge and skills;
  • Proven writing skills, with an ability to convey complex ideas in a clear, direct style;
  • Excellent knowledge of qualitative tools including but not limited to Most Significant Change Technique and Sense maker.
  • Familiar with UN M & E KOBO System will be an added advantage.

This position will implement project M&E plan, track progress/results and document lesson learnt to ensure effective implementation of the project and support to prepare project reports. The Detail ToR can be downloaded from here.

Monthly Gross Salary: NRs. 60,796/- (including all benefits for 80% LoE)

JuRI Nepal is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce and encourages candidates of diverse backgrounds, women, Dalit, marginalized, sexual and gender minorities, and persons with disabilities to apply. Only short-listed candidates will be called for the subsequent selection procedure. JuRI Nepal reserves all rights to qualify/disqualify applications in any case.

Swisscontact is an independent non-profit development organisation established in 1959 by representatives of the Swiss private sector and civil society. Our development work focuses on private sector-led, sustainable economic development with improved quality of life for all in developing and emerging countries. A key focus is to strengthen the skills of individuals and foster the competitiveness of businesses.

Swisscontact, registered as an International Non-Governmental Organisation in Nepal, has been operating in Nepal since 1991. Currently, Swisscontact in Nepal has five development programmes across all seven provinces. Swisscontact in Nepal is implementing the EU funded Creating Opportunities for Youth in Digital Economy (CODE) project in partnership with Robotics Association of Nepal and Restless Development in Gandaki and Madhesh Province. The overall objective of CODE is to contribute to inclusive and sustainable economic growth by equipping young people with the digital knowledge, skills, and opportunities necessary to participate meaningfully in the digital economy. This will be achieved through strengthening the capacities of CSOs, training service providers, schools, and local governments.

Position: Skills and Enterprise Development Manager (SEDM)
Location: Kathmandu (with frequent travel to project areas)
Reports to: Team Leader
Time: 100% (8 hours a day and 5 days a week)
Duration: 1 year with possible renewal

PURPOSE OF THE JOB

The SEDM will lead efforts to strengthen local systems for digital skills training and youth entrepreneurship in Nepal. The role oversees the design and delivery of market-relevant digital skills programs and supports youth-led digital start-ups through incubation, mentorship, and access to finance and markets. Working closely with CSOs, training providers, municipalities, and private sector actors, the Manager ensures interventions are embedded within local structures for sustainability and scale. This position requires a strategic leader with expertise in skills development, enterprise promotion, and ecosystem facilitation.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead planning, implementation, and monitoring of skills and enterprise development strategies aligned with project objectives, logframe, and outcomes.
  • Apply a systemic approach to strengthen capacities of CSOs, training providers, municipalities, ESCs, and private sector actors.
  •  Establish innovation hubs in Madhesh and Gandaki Provinces offering incubation, seed funding, mentorship, networking, and co-working facilities; develop incubation models and mentorship frameworks.
  •  Strengthen linkages between youth, startups, markets, and investors.
  •  Organise hackathons, innovation challenges, and co-creation labs to promote digital solutions for local challenges in sectors such as tourism, green energy, agriculture, and public services.
  • Drive technical development and validation of curricula on digital awareness, digital skills, and entrepreneurship; ensure alignment with industry requirements and emerging technologies.
  • Oversee training delivery, Training of Trainers (ToT), and trainer capacity building.
  • Facilitate employer engagement and ensure quality placements for trained youth.
  • Coordinate digital job fairs, enterprise showcases, pitching events, and integration of Shramsansar for job matching in the digital economy.
  • Embed interventions in local structures through MoUs and alignment with municipal and provincial plans.
  •  Ensure inclusive participation of underrepresented groups in skills and entrepreneurship programs.
  •  Build and maintain strong relationships with implementing partners, government agencies, private sector, CSOs, training providers, and IT firms.
  •  Manage workplans, budgets, risks, and coordinate with consortium partners for timely, quality implementation.
  •  Provide inputs to annual plans and progress reports; support monitoring, data analysis, and continuous improvement in collaboration with the M&E Officer.
  •  Contribute to research, learning products, and communication materials.
  •  Ensure compliance with Swisscontact’s regulations and donor requirements; coordinate with Country Office for visibility, policy alignment, and external communications.
  •  Perform other relevant tasks as assigned by the Team Leader.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Master or higher degree in social sciences, economics, development studies, business administration and/or related fields.
  • Minimum 7 years of professional experience in projects in skills development, and/or entrepreneurship development projects.
  •  Strong understanding of youth economic empowerment, youth employability challenges, and labour market trends in Nepal.
  •  Demonstrated expertise in enterprise development and strong understanding of entrepreneurial ecosystems. Experience in fostering entrepreneurship, preferably among youth, linking young entrepreneurs to finance, mentorship, and markets.
  •  Strong understanding of challenges and opportunities for start-ups, digital ventures, and support services.
  • Expertise in design and delivery of training programs including in training methodology design, curriculum development, and manual preparation. Understanding blended training models, learner-centered training approaches is preferred.
  •  Experience in capacity building of service providers, trainers, and/or training institutes and supporting effective service delivery. Experience in building capacity of national and local CSOs.
  • Demonstrated experience in leveraging private sector partnerships.
  • Proven track record of working with government agencies, private sector actors, training providers, youth organisations, and local CSOs to ensure sustainability of interventions.
  •  Excellent leadership, stakeholder management, and facilitation skills.
  •  Excellent communication and facilitation skills, with fluency in English and Nepali.
  •  Commitment to Swisscontact’s values of professionalism, inclusivity, and sustainability.

Application Procedure

Please submit online Job Application Form by clicking the link below.

Job Application Form Skills and Enterprise Development Manager

The deadline for submission of the application is January 16, 2026.

Swisscontact will not entertain any phone enquiries or other such solicitations for these positions. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the selection process. Swisscontact reserves the right to reject any
and all applications.

Swisscontact is an equal opportunity employer. Women and applicants from disadvantaged groups are encouraged to apply.

Swisscontact is an independent non-profit development organisation established in 1959 by representatives of the Swiss private sector and civil society. Our development work focuses on private sector-led, sustainable economic development with improved quality of life for all in developing and emerging countries. A key focus is to strengthen the skills of individuals and foster the competitiveness of businesses. Swisscontact, registered as an International Non-Governmental Organisation in Nepal, has been operating in Nepal since 1991. Currently, Swisscontact in Nepal has five development programmes across all seven provinces.

Swisscontact in Nepal is implementing the EU funded Creating Opportunities for Youth in Digital Economy (CODE) project in partnership with Robotics Association of Nepal and Restless Development in Gandaki and Madhesh Province. The overall objective of CODE is to contribute to inclusive and sustainable economic growth by equipping young people with the digital knowledge, skills, and opportunities necessary to participate meaningfully in the digital economy. This will be achieved through strengthening the capacities of CSOs, training service providers, schools, and local governments.

Position: Monitoring and Evaluation Officer (MEO)
Location: Kathmandu (with frequent travel to project areas)
Reports to: Team Leader
Time: 100% (8 hours a day and 5 days a week)
Duration: 1 year with possible renewal

PURPOSE OF THE JOB

The MEO is responsible for supporting the design and leading the management of M&E system that supports learning and adaptive management. The MEO shall lead the evidence generation strategies that meet the learning and reporting needs of the project assuring the quality of data and its reflection in relevant reports. The MEO plays an important role in ensuring the implementation, monitoring, and reporting of the project as per the logframe.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  •  Design and implement the project’s M&E framework, including indicators, tools, and methodologies aligned with donor requirements and Swisscontact standards.
  • Develop a robust Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) plan in close collaboration with the project team.
  • Prepare and maintain the M&E manual, ensuring compliance across programme implementation.
  •  Develop mechanisms and tools that optimise the use of evidence for adaptive management and maximise project impact.
  •  Lead the design of learning studies, impact assessments, and knowledge-sharing documents.
  • Document lessons learned and disseminate them through appropriate channels.
  • Develop and apply data collection instruments (surveys, questionnaires, checklists) tailored to digital skills and youth engagement activities.
  • Coordinate regular data collection from training providers, youth participants, and partners.
  • Ensure data quality through verification, validation, and consistency checks.
  •  Conduct periodic field monitoring of interventions and share findings for continuous improvement.
  •  Train project staff and partners on M&E tools, data collection methods, and reporting standards.
  •  Provide ongoing technical support to strengthen M&E capacity within the project team and partner organisations.
  •  Contribute to annual plans, progress reports, and donor reporting requirements.
  • Liaise with external evaluators and impact assessment teams as needed.
  •  Build and maintain strong relationships with government, private sector, NGOs, and strategic partners.
  • Coordinate and exchange information with other Swisscontact projects to ensure synergy and learning.
  •  Comply with Swisscontact’s Office Manual and organisational requirements.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline with at least 5 years of relevant work experience (Monitoring andResults Measurement and Learning).
  •  Experience with quantitative and qualitative research and capable of designing survey tools, data entry, data analysis and writing report.
  •  Good understanding of skills development, enterprise development, labour market, and youth engagement.
  • Outstanding command of MS Excel. Command of MS Access, SPSS, and other suitable statistical packages will be an added advantage.
  •  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  •  Excellent communication and facilitation skills, with fluency in English and Nepali.
  •  Commitment to Swisscontact’s values of professionalism, inclusivity, and sustainability.

Application Procedure

Please submit online Job Application Form by clicking the link below.

Job Application Form Monitoring and Evaluation Officer

The deadline for submission of the application is January 16, 2026.

Swisscontact will not entertain any phone enquiries or other such solicitations for these positions. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the selection process. Swisscontact reserves the right to reject any
and all applications.

Swisscontact is an equal opportunity employer. Women and applicants from disadvantaged groups are encouraged to apply.

Swisscontact is an independent non-profit development organisation established in 1959 by representatives of the Swiss private sector and civil society. Our development work focuses on private sector-led, sustainable economic development with improved quality of life for all in developing and emerging countries. A key focus is to strengthen the skills of individuals and foster the competitiveness of businesses.

Swisscontact, registered as an International Non-Governmental Organisation in Nepal, has been operating in Nepal since 1991. Currently, Swisscontact in Nepal has five development programmes across all seven provinces. Swisscontact in Nepal is implementing the EU funded Creating Opportunities for Youth in Digital Economy (CODE) project in partnership with Robotics Association of Nepal and Restless Development in Gandaki and
Madhesh Province. The overall objective of CODE is to contribute to inclusive and sustainable economic growth by equipping young people with the digital knowledge, skills, and opportunities necessary to participate
meaningfully in the digital economy. This will be achieved through strengthening the capacities of CSOs, training service providers, schools, and local governments.

Position: Team Leader
Location: Kathmandu (with frequent travel to project areas)
Reports to: Country Director
Time: 100% (8 hours a day and 5 days a week)
Duration: 1 year with possible renewal

PURPOSE OF THE JOB

The Team Leader is responsible for spearheading the project implementation in accordance with the approved plan, budget, logframe, and the vision, mission, and regulations of Swisscontact achieving utmost client satisfaction. The Team Leader acts on behalf of Swisscontact towards the contracting authority as well as towards external parties. The Team Leader assures overall coherence of the project as well as project performance as per the defined targets. The Team Leader decides and takes necessary steps for optimal achievement of the project objectives. The Team Leader shall also be responsible for coordinating consortium inputs ensuring the project runs smoothly. The Team Leader will also provide technical support to the project team designing, planning,
implementation, monitoring and evaluation of project activities.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Project Leadership and Management

  • Ensure adequate project management (planning-implementation-monitoring-evaluation controlling).
  •  Establish and maintain structures and instruments for planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the programme using an adaptive project management approach.
  •  Responsible for meeting the targets and objectives set forth in the logframe and delivery of annual reports and work plans.
  •  Provide strategic and technical leadership in programme decision making and effectively oversee the delivery of the programme activities in an effective and efficient manner.
  • Lead the project team and assure overall coherence regarding concepts and implementation.
  • Encourage innovations in project for the development of new products that can be replicated within the region.
  • Oversee knowledge management and capitalisation. Capitalizes project’s experiences and contribute to the further learning and development of concepts, products, and projects. Ensure complete and timely project
    documentation at all times.
  •  Adhere to the communication guidelines of Swisscontact or the client.
  •  Prepare annual operational plans and budgets for the CODE project. Nepal We create opportunities
  • Prepare timely narrative and financial reporting according to Swisscontact’s regulations and donor requirements.
  •  Ensure the project is well-prepared for all external and internal reviews and audits
  •  Manage project administration according to Swisscontact’s regulations and procedures.
  • Approve expenses and procurement of goods and services related to the project.
  • Plan and implement recruitment and development measures for project team. Ensure adequate capacity of the project staff.
  •  Ensure GEDSI, LONB, and environmental aspects are well-integrated into the programme.

Networking and Stakeholder Engagement

  •  Ensure involvement of stakeholders and consultative process in intervention designing and implementation.
  •  Ensure that CODE project goals and objectives are properly and sufficiently communicated to the public and private stakeholders, actors, and beneficiaries in three tiers of the government.
  •  Represent the project externally, particularly to partner organisations, government institutions, the private sector, national and international development agencies in all aspects of the project.
  •  Maintain effective working relationship with the client by providing timely information on all relevant project matters according to agreed procedures.
  •  Establish and maintain cooperation with relevant authorities of the Nepal government as well as with other initiatives with similar objectives in consultation with the donor.
  •  Develop and foster contacts with relevant public and private institutions and individuals.
  • Participate in all meetings (such as Project Steering Committee, Project Advisory Committee) as mandated by the requirements of the project.
  • Liaise and facilitate multistakeholder dialogue for effective support to the project.

REQUIREMENTS

  •  Master or higher degree in social sciences, economics, development studies, business administration and/or related fields.
  • Minimum 10 years of professional experience in projects in youth engagement, employment, and empowerment, skills development, and/or entrepreneurship development including at least 5 years of
    experience in leading and managing such projects.
  •  Technical expertise and experience in the field of youth engagement, youth empowerment, skills development, or enterprise development.
  • Experience in managing and leading projects with diverse and multidisciplinary teams and coordinating consortium outputs.
  •  Strong understanding of digital skills and entrepreneurship ecosystems, youth employability challenges, and labour market trends in Nepal.
  •  Proven knowledge and expertise in training methodology design, curriculum development, and manual preparation for occupational or digital skills programs that are aligned to market needs. Knowledge of digital learning platforms, blended training models, learner-centered training approaches is preferred.
  •  Experience in capacity building of trainers and/or training institutes and supporting effective training delivery.
  • Experience in building capacity of national and local CSOs.
  •  Experience in designing and implementing strategies that involve youth in policy and decision making.
  •  Experience in fostering entrepreneurship, preferably among youth, linking young entrepreneurs to finance, mentorship, and markets.
  •  Proven track record of working with government agencies, private sector actors, training providers, youth organisations, and local CSOs to ensure sustainability of interventions. Proven track record of collaboration with different government agencies at all levels including on policy development.
  •  Excellent interpersonal, leadership, and management skills.
  • Demonstrated administrative, financial, and personnel management capacities.
  • Excellent communication and facilitation skills, with fluency in English and Nepali.
  • Commitment to Swisscontact’s values of professionalism, inclusivity, and sustainability.

Application Procedure

Please submit online Job Application Form by clicking the link below.

Job Application Form Team Leader

Swisscontact will not entertain any phone enquiries or other such solicitations for these positions. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the selection process. Swisscontact reserves the right to reject any and all applications.

title.rendered: Senior Project Coordinator, Finance Coordinator, District Project Coordinator

content.rendered:
Human Rights Awareness Centre (HURAC–Nepal),Rolpa, established in 1997, is a non-profit making, non-political and leading Nepali non-governmental organization (NGO) working in the areas of rural development, human rights and social justice. HURAC has a strategic focus on protecting and promoting economic, social and cultural rights and the right to development. Its major interventions include livelihood, education, protection, health and sanitation, gender equality, child rights, advocacy, networking, research and awareness rising for people’s empowerment.

HURAC believes in result-oriented actions to address poverty, hunger, inequality, and social injustice, with special focus on children, women, marginalized and vulnerable communities.

HURAC hereby invites applications from interested and qualified Nepali citizens for the following full-time positions under the KOICA / UNFPA / Plan International funded “Safe and Enabling Environment for Adolescent Girls and Young Women (SAFE-Girls)” and Global Programme on Ending Child Marriage (ECM) projects, implemented by Human Rights Awareness Center (HURAC–Nepal) Rolpa in partnership with Plan International Nepal, working in Rolpa and Kapilvastu districts.

Project Location

HURAC Central Office, Rolpa and Project Office, Kapilvastu (with frequent field visits)

Contract Period

Project period: January 2025 to 31 December 2027

Initial contract will be for one year of 2026, with possibility of extension based on performance and fund availability.

Required Positions

 Senior Project Coordinator – 1

Duty Station: Central Office, Rolpa (with frequent travel to Kapilvastu)

Qualification and Experience

  • Master’s degree in Social Science or related field, preferably master in Health/public health
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in project coordination, community-based programmes or NGO sector
  • Experience working with local governments and donor-funded projects is an asset

Main Responsibilities

  • Lead overall planning, coordination, implementation and monitoring of project activities in Rolpa and Kapilvastu
  • Provide technical guidance and backstopping to District Project Coordinator, Finance Coordinator and field teams
  • Consolidate annual, quarterly and monthly work plans and reports
  • Ensure compliance with donor guidelines, organizational policies and safeguarding standards
  • Coordinate with municipalities, district stakeholders, networks and development partners
  • Support documentation, reporting, learning and donor monitoring visits
  • Promote GESI, child safeguarding, PSEA and accountability across all project activities

 District Project Coordinator – 1

Duty Station: Kapilvastu Project Office (with frequent field visits and coordination with Rolpa)

Qualification and Experience

  • Master’s degree in Social Science or related field having minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in project implementation and field coordination Or Bachelor’s degree in Social Science or related field having minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in project implementation and field coordination
  • Experience working with municipalities and district-level stakeholders preferred

Main Responsibilities

  • Plan, implement, monitor and report project activities at district level
  • Supervise Field Officers and coordinate with finance and procurement staff
  • Maintain coordination with local governments, DCC, FNJ, NGO Federation and partner organizations
  • Ensure quality implementation as per approved logframe and donor requirements
  • Support documentation, reporting and facilitation of monitoring visits
  • Maintain regular communication and reporting with HURAC Central Office

Finance Coordinator – 1

Duty Station: Rolpa (with frequent travel to Kapilvastu)

Qualification and Experience

  • Master’s degree in Management, Commerce, Business Studies or related field
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in finance, accounting or NGO project finance
  • Experience with FAMAS or similar accounting software preferred

Main Responsibilities

  • Prepare budgets, track expenditures and maintain accurate financial records
  • Ensure financial compliance with donor and organizational policies
  • Maintain accounting records, vouchers, advances and reconciliations
  • Prepare and submit periodic financial reports and fund requests
  • Support procurement processes, audits and financial monitoring visits
  • Provide financial guidance and support to project and field teams

APPLICATION AND INTERVIEW PROCESS:

The last date for submitting application is 8th January 2026. Please send a cover letter, a recent CV, documents and a passport size photo to procurement.hurac@gmail.com

Or alternatively, drop application in person at HURAC office in Liwang or Project office Bhalubang

*Please indicate clearly the position title while applying for the subject of your application. In addition, all applicants must complete the mandatory Google Application Form using the link below:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeFWlrbVEaKj81f8m9SWzd8U4cPskvSJGd1Jz78r4qRB4XF6w/viewform?usp=dialog

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Telephone inquiries will not be entertained with this regard.

We encourage women, Dalits, Person with disability and minority groups to apply.
