Position: Sponsorship Program Manager

The Opportunity

Save the Children believes every child deserves a future. In Bhutan and around the world, we give children a healthy start in life, the opportunity to learn and protection from harm. We do whatever it takes for children – every day and in times of crisis – transforming their lives and future we share. Save the Children expects that anyone associated with it abides by its Safeguarding and other Zero Tolerance Policies.

Under the close supervision of the Head of Field Program Operations-BFO, the Manager – Sponsorship Program will have the overall responsibility tor lead and manage the BFO based Sponsorship program. The position holder will be responsible to ensure that high quality programs are delivered reaching children most impacted by inequality and discrimination throughout the project areas of SC. Furthermore, the position holder will also be responsible to ensure that the program implementation is as per the Social Ecological model; there is integration between different components of the program, and regular quality monitoring. The position holder will also be accountable for the financial management of the project, management of the project personnel, adherence to administrative requirement /compliances, partnership management and overall management of sponsorship program in the field office.

As Sponsorship program is of integrated nature – this needs to be considered and incorporated into the all steps of project cycle to create synergy effect. Working closely with the Technical Managers (TMs) and the support functions, the position holder will execute sponsorship program including capacity building process of the partners NGOs and SC sponsorship team. The position holder will also carry out communication of the project at partners, Country Office (CO) and donors level. . Ensure the grants, funds tracking mechanisms are in place and quality reports are prepared and submitted on timely manner and responses on corrective measures are taken proactively. Oversee management of all partner organizations in the field office under sponsorship program and ensure that the project/ program compliance of sponsorship are met. Ensure systematic documentation, digitalization as appropriate, and dissemination of project achievements. The position holder will also oversee that field visits the project site are carried out smoothly and regularly. The position holder will communicate, guide and mobilise the team members and partners and execute the projects designed for the QIP phase and ensure smooth transition in IA-1 area as per the OT plan.

KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY :

Quality implementation of sponsorship program

  • Execution of Sponsorship program as per the plan, quality, compliances and guideline under BFO
  • Coordinate with FO and CO level Technical team for technical assistance in the Sponsorship Program.
  • Support and ensure kick off/ program orientation of the Sponsorship Program at partners level
  • Provide clear directions/guidance to the project team, partner organization’s team in designing cost effective, result oriented projects/programs, in collaboration with government (as appropriate) for long lasting impact on target beneficiaries in line with SCI’s CSP, CAP and member country requirements.
  • Ensure quality benchmarks are being used by the project team
  • Ensure supplies are of quality and cost effective and procured in a timely manner
  • Identify capacity strengthening gaps of SCI and partner staff under the sponsorship team and ensure capacity strengthening activities are designed and undertaken
  • Ensure a fit for purpose structure of the sponsorship team both at SCI and at partners level.
  • Explore and implement innovative and new/ effective initiatives in the program with the support of technical team and sponsorship team.
  • Ensure that programs are designed and, implemented in line with the principles of safer programming
  • Identify areas/topics for research and studies under sponsorship program and share its findings with all relevant internal and external stakeholders
  • Comply with Save the Children’s policies and practice with respect to safeguarding, code of conduct, health and safety, equal opportunities and other relevant policies and procedures.
  • Ensure program interventions are developed to address the issues of Children impacted by discrimination and inequality for GESI, Disability, and Climate change prespective.

Project / program management and development

  • Lead, provide oversight and manage sponsorship program in BFO.
  • Develop detailed program implementation plan/ work plans along with budget; conduct periodic review and adjust additional budget with contingency planning and track to achieve the monthly KPIs.
  • Ensure all the project documents are in place and referred as when required as per Program Operational Manual.
  • Ensure the implementation of Project Management Methodology (PMM) tools as appropriate in sponsorship program and readiness for PRIME adaptation as SCI priority.
  • Ensure project tracking systems are developed for tracking progress, budget expenses on monthly basis; undertake immediate and prompt corrective actions as required in close coordination with Sponsorship Program team and finance point persons in BFO and in KTM POD team.
  • Organize Comprehensive Compliance Monitoring/Joint Monitoring based on risk assessment
  • Conduct periodic program review meeting to see/share the progress, lesson learnt, best practices and suggestion from partners for further improvement in program management/ implementation of sponsorship program
  • Ensure documentation and dissemination of sponsorship program progress with support from the Advocacy, Communications, Campaign and Media (ACCM) team

Program Partners’ Management

  • Ensure adequate technical and managerial backstopping is provided to Partner NGOs to enhance their organizational capacity for better performance.
  • Ensure that project team embodies the SCI partnership management principles while working with partner organisations .
  • Ensure that partnership management is in line with Nepal Partnership Strategy and follows the standard SCI and Nepal partnership management processes and systems.
  • Ensure phase in and phase out plans for partners are in place and documented.
  • Ensure project team are for regularly following up and supporting the PNGOs for project / program and budget progress, verifying implementation, monitoring, reporting, documentation etc.
  • Ensure SCI team are aware on SCI policies and compliances and are facilitating / orienting partners accordingly.
  • Support the roll out of Nepal Partnership Graduation model and localization policy at FO and partner level
  • Ensure that partners receive adequate support and facilitation for compliances with safer partnerships requirements and standards

Administrative Management

  • Ensure daily administrative management of sponsorship team
  • Perform role as budget holder of sponsorship program in FO
  • Review / approve or necessary action on the sponsorship program related budget and activities
  • Process annual sub-award or amendment of the sponsorship program with partners with the support of sponsorship team
  • Ensure the clear lines of communication are maintained between the SCI staff, PNGOs and Country office.
  • Coordinate with supply chain, finance, technical team and MEAL team and ensure timely support into the sponsorship program/ partners.

People Management

  • Conduct periodical assessment/review and plan for required staff/project structure for the efficiency of sponsorship program
  • Support HR department for sponsorship staff recruitment process and engage in the recruitment of staff under sponsorship program
  • Update and submit the job description of the staff under sponsorship program as required.
  • Ensure all sponsorship team have clear performance objectives, based on their job descriptions and evaluate the staff’s performances and provide feedback for their performance improvement and capacity building
  • Ensure all staff members have monthly work plans in place with substantial amount of time provided to monitoring of project/partners using standard check-lists/ monitoring plan/ Risk matrix and well documented reports of field visit and support.
  • Provide mentoring and coaching to the staff members for their capacity building.

Financial Management

  • Ensure sponsorship program annual budget are clearly developed in phase budget frame, with monthly, quarterly breakdowns.
  • Ensure that the sponsorship team closely follow up and ensure project / program activities and budget progresses as per plan.
  • Ensure sponsorship team carries partner wise follow up of activities progress and expenses tracking and proceed with corrective actions if needed.
  • Function as the budget holder for sponsorship projects and ensure the management of budget is in line with the approved plan/ ceiling.
  • Ensure monthly tracking of budget planned versus expenditure are in place
  • Closely work with finance team and draw areas of improvement in the project
  • Ensure the implementation of audit plan and carry out recommendations / action plans.

Reporting

  • Ensure monthly, quarterly, half-yearly and annual progress reports (both program and financial as per requirement) are prepared, monitored and reviewed as relevant
  • Ensure the data consistency, and use of digital documentation of data. Ensure partners are submitting their reports on time.
  • Lead, Coordinate and ensure the engagement of technical Managers and sponsorship program team in the report writing process of sponsorship program
  • Ensure timely and quality reporting to donors.

Representation

  • Represent the organization in government, international agencies, networks and donors as and when required by BFO.
  • Maintain close relationship with Provincial and local governments, I/NGOs, UN, & donors to ensure that programs are implemented in an effective and coordinated manner and maintain good public relations

Emergency

  • Ensure District/ Municipal level emergency response process if required.
  • Supporting Save the Children’s full-spectrum mandate as well as being the leader in emergency preparedness and response for children.

Occasional Significant Duties

  • Arrange and lead visit of visitors in the Sponsorship Program site
  • Perform duties as and when required or assigned by the organization / line manager

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Master’s degree or equivalent in Management or related discipline(s)
  • At least 7 years of working experience in similar field(s)
  • Supporting Program/ projects /partners for its Quality implementation
  • Project / program management and development
  • Program Partners’ Management
  • Administrative Management
  • Personnel Management
  • Financial Management
  • Representation
  • Excellent inter-personal communication skills
  • Good presentation skills
  • Good supportive supervision skills, developing self and others
  • Excellent English communication skills, specifically written
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver results, engage in effective and collaborative problem solving and decision making, and foster program innovations and adaptations

Desireable

  • Advanced knowledge about Child Poverty sector policies and context in Nepal
  • Sound knowledge and experiences in designing and implementation of pro-poor livelihood and marketing programs along with a good knowledge of child sensitive social protection.

Required No.(s): 1 (Nepalese Citizen Only)

Contract length: Fixed Term

Location: Bardibas Field Office

The Organisation

We employ approximately 25,000 people across the globe and work on the ground in over 100 countries to help children affected by crises, or those that need better healthcare, education and child protection. We also campaign and advocate at the highest levels to realise the right of children and to ensure their voices are heard.

We are working towards three breakthroughs in how the world treats children by 2030:

  • No child dies from preventable causes before their 5th birthday
  • All children learn from a quality basic education and that,
  • Violence against children is no longer tolerated

We know that great people make a great organization, and that our employees play a crucial role in helping us achieve our ambitions for children. We value our people and offer a meaningful and rewarding career, along with a collaborative and inclusive workplace where ambition, creativity, and integrity are highly valued.

Application Information

Please apply using a cover letter and up-to-date CV as a single document. Please also include details of your current remuneration and salary expectations.

We need to keep children safe so our selection process, which includes rigorous background checks, reflects our commitment to the protection of children from abuse.

All employees are expected to carry out their duties in accordance with our global anti-harassment policy.

Save the Children does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruitment process.

Job Info

Apply Before: 01/08/2026, 11:59 PM
Job Schedule: Full time

KIRDARC Nepal is a non-governmental organization committed to promoting and protecting the rights of marginalized and excluded communities. Its core focus areas include Human Rights, Democracy, and Good Governance. With a strong emphasis on strengthening the capacities of rights holders, duty bearers, and civil society actors, KIRDARC Nepal contributes to inclusive growth and equitable development. Guided by its vision of fostering a just, inclusive, and prosperous society where individuals have equitable access to and control over resources, the organization strives to promote community empowerment and local ownership.

In collaboration with Save the Children International, KIRDARC Nepal is currently implementing an integrated project in Tatopani Rural Municipality of Jumla District. The project aims to enhance students’ access to quality basic education, promote the implementation of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC) by government institutions and civil society, and establish safe, protective, and child-friendly environments within schools, health facilities, and other community settings. In this context, KIRDARC Nepal invites applications from competent, qualified, dynamic, and motivated Nepali citizens for the following full-time position:

Position Title: MEAL & Documentation Officer-Adolescent MNH -1 Person (Based in Tatopani Rural Municipality of Jumla district)

Academic Qualification and Experience: The candidate should have a bachelor’s degree in public health, or another relevant degree with more than three years of experience. Experience should be in monitoring and evaluation, research, reporting, and documentation, or in adolescent, maternal, and neonatal health programs. Prior work experience with I/NGOs will be considered an advantage.

Key Skills and Knowledge required: –

The candidate should possess strong skills in monitoring and evaluation, research methodologies, and report writing, along with sound knowledge of adolescent, maternal, and neonatal health. Familiarity with data management systems is essential, and experience in using DHIS2 will be considered an added asset. Additionally, the candidate has excellent computer skills, including proficiency in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. For more details, visit the detail job description here

Interested candidates who meet these criteria should send their Application Letter and KIRDARC Job Application Form to vacancy@kirdarc.org by January 8, 2026, before 5:00 PM. The CV/Resume is not necessary to submit but the prescribed KIRDARC Job Application Form is mandatorily required to apply. The interested candidates can download the KIRDARC Job Application form from here.

Preference will be given to disadvantaged groups (Female, Dalit, Janajati, People with disability) and local resident in the recruitment process. The person working with this organization must be committed to following the provisions of the child protection and safeguarding policy of the organization. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Any telephone inquiries/and or attempts to apply undue influence will result in the disqualification of candidates. KIRDARC Nepal reserves the right to reject any application without assigning any reason whatsoever.

Note: The written test will be conducted physically at different cluster offices of KIRDARC Nepal. Candidates will be informed about the available locations and may select the one that is most convenient for them.

  •  Prepare market survey reports through visits, calls, and virtual meetings.
  •  Follow up with dealers according to agreed payment schedules.
  •  Present company products and services to dealers, resellers, and end-users.
  •  Coordinate with Logistics and Support Center teams to ensure client satisfaction.
  •  Gain in-depth knowledge of ERP systems and all company brands.
  •  Maintain high levels of professionalism at all times.
  •  Maintain proper internal and inter-departmental communication.
  •  Maintain respectful interactions with internal teams and external stakeholders (partners, banks, vendors, authorities).

Qualification & Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Sales and Marketing, or any related field.
  • Minimum 1 year of experience.
  • Good communication and coordination skills.
  •  Ability to work independently and with cross-functional team.

Position: Programme Policy Officer (Head WFP Western Nepal Region), SCL9
Location: Surkhet

DEADLINE FOR APPLICATIONS: 11 January 2026-23:59-GMT+05:45 Nepal Time (Kathmandu)

WFP celebrates and embraces diversity. It is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all its employees and encourages qualified candidates to apply irrespective of race, colour, national origin, ethnic or social background, genetic information, gender, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, religion or belief, HIV status or disability.

ABOUT WFP

The World Food Programme is the world’s largest humanitarian organization saving lives in emergencies and using food assistance to build a pathway to peace, stability and prosperity, for people recovering from conflict, disasters and the impact of climate change.

At WFP, people are at the heart of everything we do and the vision of the future WFP workforce is one of diverse, committed, skilled, and high performing teams, selected on merit, operating in a healthy and inclusive work environment, living WFP’s values (Integrity, Collaboration, Commitment, Humanity, and Inclusion) and working with partners to save and change the lives of those WFP serves.

To learn more about WFP, visit our website: https://www.wfp.org and follow us on social media to keep up with our latest news: YouTube, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, TikTok.

WHY JOIN WFP?

  • WFP is a 2020 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate.
  • WFP offers a highly inclusive, diverse, and multicultural working environment.
  • WFP invests in the personal & professional development of its employees through a range of training, accreditation, coaching, mentorship, and other programs as well as through internal mobility opportunities.
  • A career path in WFP provides an exciting opportunity to work across the various country, regional and global offices around the world, and with passionate colleagues who work tirelessly to ensure that effective humanitarian assistance reaches millions of people across the globe.
  • We offer an attractive compensation package (please refer to the Terms and Conditions section of this vacancy announcement).

WFP encourages female candidates and people with disabilities to apply.

BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE OF THE ASSIGNMENT:

Under its five-year Country Strategic Plan, WFP Nepal is implementing an integrated set of activities spanning across four outcome areas. Under a food systems umbrella, the plan combines Emergency Prepared and Response, Nutrition and School Meals, Climate Resilience and Service Provision. A focused gender, disability and social inclusion lens as well as a strong analysis capacity constitute the foundation of all activities. In addition, the country office’s work has its corporate localization policy at the Centre, emphasizing the importance of capacitating all three tiers of government, as per constitutional provisions related to the Right to Food, and with a particular focus on local governments. Therefore, our field presence in the western region of Nepal is fundamental in overseeing all our investments on the ground and in supporting the government to achieve its development goals vis a vis SDG2, 17 and beyond.

TERMS AND CONDITION

Position Title: Programme Policy Officer (Head WFP Western Nepal Region) SC L9

Contract Type: Service Contract (SC)
Level: SC L9

Contract Duration: 12 months (Renewable)

Duty Station: Surkhet
Deadline of Application: 11.01.2026

WFP offers a competitive benefits package including salary plus CIGNA health insurance

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

Under the overall guidance of the Country Director and the direct supervision of Deputy Country Director, the incumbent will be responsible for the following tasks:

  • Oversee the day-to-day management of all WFP operations in western Nepal and ensure the continued development of a cohesive and high performing team.
  • Plan and implement, together with the country office technical support units, all WFP operations within the area of assignment to ensure effective and efficient delivery and integration of assistance.
  • Ensure that allocated resources are used efficiently and are in line with agreed plans, and any deviations are reported to the supervisor.
  • Hold accountability for the security of WFP staff, operations, premises and assets in the Western Region to ensure that WFP security and safety standards are locally set and followed. Actively participate and contribute to the Area Security Management Team (ASMT).
  • Under the overall guidance of the Head of RAM and team at the Country Office, conduct timely monitoring and evaluation of activities and prepare accurate and comprehensive reports on WFP’s operations and performance as appropriate.
  • Design joint projects with UN and other partners in close coordination with CO Program Unit.
  • Build effective and collaborative relations with Provincial (Sudur Paschim and Karnali Provinces) and Local Governments (in dedicated project areas) and contribute to the expertise sharing and capacity building for effective preparedness and response to needs as per our mandate.
  • Build strategic and productive partnerships to develop and sustain liaison with local government authorities, international and local NGOs, UN agencies, civil societies, beneficiaries and other partners and media.
  • Ensure extensive and frequent presence at project areas, distribution sites and other investment sites.
  • Contribute towards the development of a wide variety of projects, plans and processes, ensuring alignment with wider programme policies and guidance.
  • Guide and supervise more junior staff, acting as a point of referral and supporting them with analysis and queries.
  • Others as required by the function as and when required.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Education:

Advanced University degree in International Affairs, Economics, Nutrition/Health, Agriculture, Environmental Science, Social Sciences or other field relevant to international development assistance, or First University Degree with additional years of related work experience and/or trainings/courses.

Experience:

Three or more years of strongly relevant advanced university degree (after master’s degree) professional work experience

DESIRED EXPERIENCES FOR ENTRY INTO THE ROLE:

    • Has developed, or supported in the development of, single discipline work plans to support the achievement of WFP strategic aims within a defined area.
    • Has gained some exposure in field operations, preferably in a hardship duty station or emergency situation.
    • Has field experience via field rotations or working in a sub-office, and through field postings.
    • Gained experience of analyzing local political situations and assessing risk accurately.
    • Gained broader exposure across areas within a function (i.e. policy, programme etc.).
    • Has gained experience managing small to mid-size financial budgets, balancing priorities effectively.
    • Has experience leading a small to mid-size team to ensure the effective delivery of objectives.
    • Participated in a vendor/government/ partner negotiation within area of focus.
    • Participated in a small emergency operation/ development programme.
    • Has experience with security co-ordination and compound management within a smaller area.
    • Has deepened technical knowledge through exposure to technical teams.
    • Has taken leadership of implementing programmes.
    • Has provided input into policy discussions and decisions.

    Languages:

    Fluency in both oral and written communication in English and in Nepali languages is a requirement. Knowledge of local languages is an added value.

    WFP LEADERSHIP FRAMEWORK

    WFP Leadership Framework guides to the common standards of behavior that guide HOW we work together to accomplish our mission.

    Click here to access WFP Leadership Framework
    REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION

    WFP is committed to supporting individuals with disabilities by providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process. If you require a reasonable accommodation, please contact: global.inclusion@wfp.org

    NO FEE DISCLAIMER

    The United Nations does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. Should you receive a solicitation for the payment of a fee, please disregard it. Furthermore, please note that emblems, logos, names and addresses are easily copied and reproduced. Therefore, you are advised to apply particular care when submitting personal information on the web.

    REMINDERS BEFORE YOU SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION

    • All applications must be submitted exclusively through our online recruitment system. We do not accept CVs or spontaneous applications by email.
    • If you experience challenges while submitting your online application, please contact us at global.hrerecruitment@wfp.org for technical support only.
    • Please note that applications sent to this email address cannot be considered.
    • We strongly recommend that your profile is accurate, complete, and includes your employment records, academic qualifications, language skills and UN Grade (if applicable).
    • Once your profile is completed, please apply, and submit your application.
    • Kindly note the only documents you will need to submit at this time are your CV and Cover Letter
    • Additional documents such as passport, recommendation letters, academic certificates, etc. may potentially be requested at a future time
    • Only shortlisted candidates will be notified

    All employment decisions are made on the basis of organizational needs, job requirements, merit, and individual qualifications. WFP is committed to providing an inclusive work environment free of sexual exploitation and abuse, all forms of discrimination, any kind of harassment, sexual harassment, and abuse of authority. Therefore, all selected candidates will undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

    No appointment under any kind of contract will be offered to members of the UN Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions (ACABQ), International Civil Service Commission (ICSC), FAO Finance Committee, WFP External Auditor, WFP Audit Committee, Joint Inspection Unit (JIU) and other similar bodies within the United Nations system with oversight responsibilities over WFP, both during their service and within three years of ceasing that service.

title.rendered: Team Leader /Dialogue Expert, Monitoring, Evaluation, and Knowledge Management

content.rendered:
Creating an enabling environment for Women’s Economic advancement through Dialogue (CEEWEAD) is an 18-month development project managed by GIZ with the jointly funded by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development and the European Union. Forum for Protection of Public Interest (Pro Public), established in 1991, a national-level non-governmental organization working in the areas of democracy, good governance, inclusion, gender equality, social justice, and civic engagement, is a national thematic partner for the implementation of this project. The aim of this project is to create an enabling environment for women’s economic advancement by addressing critical issues of participation, resource access, asset ownership, decision-making power, and skill development within the context of male overseas migration. Pro Public aims to address the critical issues impeding women’s economic advancement by using tools of dialogue to foster mutual understanding and to bring about shifts in the atti

Pro Public is seeking expression of interests from qualified, experienced, and motivated Nepali Experts to fulfill the following positions.

Position Title: Team Leader /Dialogue Expert

Role Summary:

The Team Leader/Dialogue expert will bring expertise to the structured seven-steps social dialogue process, facilitating citizen–government dialogues in close alignment with local governments from inception to exit policy workshops. The expert will ensure the delivery of intended project outcomes and outputs while providing technical guidance to Dialogue Facilitators (DFs). The expert will also conduct trainings on intensive, relevant professional courses, including Non-Violent Communication, mediation skill, Gender and Women’s Participation, Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights, and other related areas.

Key Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Facilitate trainings for Dialogue Facilitators, building their capacity to provide technical support for creating an enabling environment for Women’s Economic Advancement through Dialogue.
  • Lead and guide the design and implementation of the seven-steps social dialogue process, facilitating citizen–government dialogues in close alignment with local governments from inception to exit policy workshops.
  • Provide overall supervision and regular guidance to Program Officers and Dialogue Facilitators to ensure smooth project implementation.
  • Support the project team in documentation, reporting, and ensuring quality standards in dialogue processes and workshops.

Location: Based in Kathmandu, Nepal with frequent travel to the project locations (Koshi, Karnali and Sudurpanchim)

Contract Type: Short-Term Consultancy Agreement

Duration: 90 days

Qualification & Experience:

  • A minimum of a Master’s degree in a relevant discipline.
  • At least seven years of intensive and specific experience in dialogue facilitation, mediation, and related areas.
  • Completion of professional courses such as Training on Dialogue Facilitation (Particularly on seven steps dialogue), Mediation, Non-Violent Communication, and relevant training in Gender and Women’s Participation, Economic, Social, and Cultural Rights.
  • Demonstrated experience in successfully leading multiple projects in similar areas and expertise with multiple development partners is essential.

Position Title: Monitoring, Evaluation, and Knowledge Management (M&E & KM)

Role Overview:

The M&E & KM Expert will provide technical expertise in designing and implementing a robust Monitoring, Evaluation, and Knowledge Management framework for the project. S/he will ensure that the ME Framework thus designed effectively tracks progress, measures outcomes, and captures transformative changes, particularly related to gender norms, economic behaviors, and social accountability. The expert will also integrate knowledge management approaches to document lessons learned, promote adaptive management, and facilitate evidence-based decision-making for stakeholders and donors.

Key Responsibilities / Tasks:

  • Design, develop, and implement the project’s comprehensive M&E framework, including logical frameworks, detailed implementation plans (DIP), and gender-sensitive indicators.
  • Conduct data collection, verification, and analysis to track project progress, outcomes, and impact.
  • Facilitate learning and knowledge sharing sessions for project teams and stakeholders to ensure adaptive management and informed decision-making.
  • Provide technical guidance and support to field staff and in applying M&E tools and methodologies effectively.
  • Document lessons learned best practices, and key findings to contribute to knowledge management and future programming.

Location: Based in Kathmandu, Nepal with frequent travel to the project locations (Koshi, Karnali and Sudurpanchim)

Contract Type: Short-Term Consultancy Agreement

Duration: 20 days

Qualification & Experience:

  • A Master’s degree in a relevant discipline.
  • Experience in M&E and knowledge management of development projects.Strong knowledge of participatory and adaptive M&E methodologies.
  • Excellent documentation, analytical, and reporting skills.

Remuneration and Benefits:

Applicants are requested to specify their daily fee, (exclusive of travel and daily allowance) rate in their application.

Safeguarding and Ethics Applicable for the position

  • Successful resource person/experts adhere to all the procedures, policies, and security guidelines of Pro Public and development partners.
  • Successful resource person/experts promote security awareness and ensure compliance with relevant procedures.
  • Successful resource person/experts uphold Pro Public’s Code of Conduct, preventing exploitation, abuse, and harassment while fostering diversity, equity, and inclusivity.

Application Process:

Qualified and interested candidates with the required qualifications, experience and not 100% commitment in any government and non-government institutions are invited to submit their application, including a recent CV, two professional references, supporting documents, and a passport-sized photograph, by January 12, 2025. Women, Dalit, Janajati, Madheshi, Muslim candidates, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the next stage of the selection process. Inquiries regarding the application will not be entertained, and any attempt to influence the selection process will result in automatic disqualification.

Pro Public reserves the right to accept or reject any application without providing any explanation.

The Executive Director

Pro Public

NagarjunMarga, Anamnagar

Kathmandu, Nepal

Email: propublic.vacancy2024@gmail.com

Aafanta Nepal (KIN NEPAL) is a nationally recognized, not-for-profit non-governmental organization (NGO), established in 2008 in Lalitpur with a mission to combat human trafficking in Nepal by rehabilitating and empowering affected individuals and strengthening communities. The organization is committed to enhancing and safeguarding the human rights, justice, and dignity of women and girls.

Aafanta Nepal aims to transform the lives of rescued and vulnerable women and girls, as well as their communities, through comprehensive interventions including rescue and rehabilitation, psychosocial counseling, capacity building, empowerment, and community reintegration.

Guided by this approach, Aafanta Nepal prioritizes its programmatic focus on Prevention, Protection, and Prosecution, while also strengthening coordination, building strategic alliances, and conducting advocacy initiatives to combat human trafficking, gender-based violence, and the sexual exploitation of women in Nepal.

Aafanta Nepal invites applications from dynamic, qualified, and self-motivated Nepali citizens for the following position.

Priority will be given to female candidates and survivors of human trafficking and GBV.

Position: Project Director

Duty Station: Head Office, Lalitpur

Field Requirement: Minimum 60% field visits covering Aafanta Nepal’s operational areas

Reports To: Executive Director

Job Purpose

The Project Director will provide overall strategic and operational leadership for Aafanta Nepal’s programs, ensuring effective implementation of Safe Home Rehabilitation Services, Border Surveillance Initiatives, and Community Engagement Activities. The position is responsible for managing multi-district operations, supervising multidisciplinary teams, strengthening stakeholder coordination, and ensuring survivor-centered, ethical, and compliant program delivery aligned with Aafanta Nepal’s mission to end human trafficking and GBV.

Minimum Qualifications and Experience Required

Education

  • Master’s degree in Development Studies, Social Work, Gender Studies, Psychology, Management, Public Administration, Law, or a related field.

Experience

  • Minimum 3–5 years of relevant program management experience in NGOs/INGOs, preferably in anti-trafficking, gender-based violence (GBV), child protection, or humanitarian sectors, with a legal or law-related educational background considered an added advantage.

Knowledge, Skills & Experience

  • Proven experience managing multi-district and donor-funded programs.
  • Strong leadership skills in supervising multidisciplinary and field-based teams.
  • Demonstrated experience in survivor-centered, trauma-informed rehabilitation and recovery programs.
  • Sound knowledge of human trafficking, GBV, migration, child protection, and safeguarding standards in Nepal.
  • Strong advocacy, networking, and stakeholder engagement skills.
  • Experience coordinating with government authorities, NGOs/INGOs, and donors.
  • Excellent planning, reporting, documentation, and communication skills.
  • Ability to integrate Gender Equality and Social Inclusion (GESI) principles into programs.
  • High ethical standards, confidentiality, accountability, and integrity.
  • Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
  • Competency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Ability to work independently and in diverse, cross-cultural team environments.
  • Strong commitment to social justice, survivor empowerment, and the vision, mission, values, and principles of Aafanta Nepal.

Interested candidates who meet the above criteria are invited to submit their updated CV along with a Letter of Interest no later than 8 January 2026, before 2:00 PM, to the following address:

HR Department

Aafanta Nepal (KIN Nepal)

Email: jobs.kinnepal@gmail.com

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further selection procedures.

Aafanta Nepal reserves the right to accept or reject any application, or to cancel the recruitment process at any stage, if deemed necessary.

United Mission to Nepal Medical Development Trust (UMN MDT) is a public trust that aims to enable the poorest people living in poverty to transform their lives, leading towards the fullness of life. As we serve the people of Nepal, multicultural teams of Nepali and volunteer expatriate staff work alongside local organisations in eleven districts (nine clusters) and operate two mission hospitals, United Mission Hospital Tansen in Palpa and Okhaldhunga Community Hospital in Okhaldhunga, building partnerships that foster healthy, dignified, and empowered individuals and transformed communities.

Position: Project Manager – Resilient Livelihoods (Roots to Resilience)

Required No.: 1

Based in: Karnali Province Cluster, Birendranagar, Surkhet

The main purpose of this position is to lead and ensure the successful implementation of the Seed of Change: Roots to Resilience (R2R) Project, while contributing to UMN MDT’s Karnali Province Cluster strategy through effective capacity building, relationship building, project management, and the provision of technical expertise.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • A Master’s Degree in Agriculture, Environmental Science, Climate Change, or a related field, with at least three years of professional experience in resilient livelihoods, enterprise development, climate resilience, disaster risk reduction and integrated project management; OR
  • a Bachelor’s Degree in the above disciplines with at least five years of relevant professional experience.
  • Excellent knowledge and understanding of livelihoods and poverty, food security, agricultural and non-agricultural market systems, climate resilience, disaster risk reduction and social empowerment in the context of rural Nepal.
  • Skills in climate-resilient agriculture, and Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET), green enterprises and agribusiness development.
  • Skills in people-centred market system development, including market assessment, training needs assessment and business plan development.
  • Experience in conducting Climate and Disaster Vulnerability and Capacity Assessments (CVCA) and supporting the development of community-based resilience and adaptation plans.
  • Experience in community empowerment approaches, such as community empowerment process, self-help approach and participatory action reflection.
  • Experience in group capacity assessment and strengthening, and in mainstreaming Gender Equality, Disability and Social Inclusion (GEDSI), as well as addressing harmful social practices.
  • Strong skills and experience in project management, including design, planning, budgeting, monitoring, reporting, and developing concept notes and proposals.
  • Sound understanding of results framework and indicators, including their measurement, with practical experience in monitoring, data management, and reporting using tools such as Excel and KoboCollect.
  • Skills in coordination, rapport building and networking with local and district-level stakeholders.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Nepali.

Salaries and benefits will be according to UMN MDT policy.

All interested individuals who meet the minimum qualifications are encouraged to apply for this position. The Job Description and Application Form can be downloaded below.

Completed application forms should be sent by email to nepali.recruit@umn.org.np by 5:00 pm on Tuesday, 13 January 2026. Short-listed candidates will be invited to participate in an assessment process.

We highly encourage applications from marginalised groups.

Friends Affected & Infected Together in Hand (FAITH) is a national, women-led, non-profit, and non-religious organization that works to empower and support marginalized women, indigenous communities, and those excluded due to geography, or economic hardship.

Role Overview

FAITH is seeking a qualified and motivated Program Officer with expertise in policy advocacy and program implementation in sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR), gender-based violence (GBV), and gender equality. The officer will support and protect adolescents, girls, and women from indigenous communities, as well as HIV key populations, including women living with HIV, female sex workers, and women who use drugs.

Position: Program Officer

Key Responsibilities:

  • Engage with parliamentarians, policymakers, and other stakeholders to raise awareness of issues related to GBV, sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR), and the challenges faced by HIV key populations.
  • Advocate for comprehensive Gender Equality and Social Inclusion (GESI) policies, GBV prevention measures, and SRHR rights.
  • Collaborate with the Nepal Police and other duty bearers to promote respect for human rights and enhance accountability in addressing GBV and SRHR issues.
  • Establish and maintain regular communication channels with local government, police, and other relevant stakeholders to ensure effective coordination and implementation of program activities.
  • Support program planning, implementation, and monitoring, ensuring advocacy perspectives are integrated throughout.
  • Maintain thorough documentation and reporting of program activities, advocacy initiatives, and stakeholder engagements.
  • Contribute to the development of knowledge products, policy briefs, and advocacy materials to support evidence-based interventions.

Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in public health, social work, gender studies or related field.
  • 5-7 years of experience coordinating with government agencies.
  • Strong knowledge of GBV issues, international standards, and best practices.
  • Proven experience in coordinating with policymakers and engaging diverse stakeholders.
  • Strong team and independent work skills, with excellent organizational and time management abilities.
  • Excellent communication and advocacy skills.
  • Fluency in written and spoken English.
  • Preference given to candidates with experience in HIV KP rights advocacy and indigenous communities.

Application Process:

Interested candidates are requested to submit a resume, cover letter, recent photograph, two references (one from current/last organization), driving/scooter license number, salary history, and expected salary to faithvacancy@gmail.com. Please mention “Program Officer” in the subject line. Only complete applications will be processed, and shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews.

Those who do not meet the essential qualification including those without driving/scooter license are kindly requested to refrain from applying.

We welcome and encourage applications from women of diverse backgrounds. Women from ethnic groups and disadvantaged communities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Deadline for applications: 19 January 2026

Position: Office Secretary
Location: Kathmandu

The Human Resources Society Nepal (HRSN) is dynamic professional platform dedicated to advancing field of Human Resource Management in Nepal. Established in 2013 A.D. and legally registered under Nepalese law, HRSN provides a collaborative space where HR professionals can connect, share insights, and exchange best practices to enhance the profession collectively.

As non-political, non-profit organization, HRSN is committed to promoting awareness about the critical role of HR management in Nepalese organizations. It strives empower HR professionals by fostering continuous learning and professionals development through workshops, training programs, seminars, and knowledge-sharing sessions. The initiatives help individuals stay informed about emerging trends, industry best practices, and evolving workplace dynamics.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage office files, records, and confidential documents
  • Handle incoming and outgoing calls, emails, and official correspondence
  • Prepare and circulate accurate meeting minutes after every Board Meeting
  • Communicate and coordinate with speakers, members, participants, sponsors, and partners
  • Coordinate and organize regular Knowledge Sharing Sessions (KSS)
  • Ensure smooth execution of events with quality participant experience as per our annual activities calendar
  • Ensure proper documentation, reporting, and record maintenance for all activities
  • Maintain member database, event records, and official files in an organized manner
  • Prepare event schedules, invitations, and communication materials
  • Coordinate with vendors, suppliers, and service providers for events
  • Monitor event budgets and ensure cost-effective execution
  • Oversee on-site event execution and post-event reporting
  • Manage HRSN’s visibility on LinkedIn, Facebook, and other digital platforms
  • Collect feedback and support continuous improvement of programs
  • Coordinate with sponsors and ensure timely collection of confirmed sponsor payments
  • Follow up and ensure timely collection of participant fees for events and programs
  • Maintain financial trackers and regularly update achievement status to the Executive Board

Required Skills & Competencies:

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities
  • Event planning and coordination skills
  • Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Ability to work under deadlines and manage multiple activities
  • Professional demeanor with attention to detail

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent (preferred)
  • 3–5 years of experience in office administration and/or event management
  • Experience in corporate event coordination will be an added advantage

APPLY NOW AT:

  •  info@hrsocietynepal.org
  •  hrconference.nepal@gmail.com

Community Development & Advocacy Forum Nepal (CDAFN) Bardibas, Mahottari is a NGO dedicated to uphold the rights of marginalized and excluded communities through its interventions on Health, Education, Livelihood, Protection and Climate Change Adaptation Mitigation, Chure Conservation, Disaster Risk Reduction Management, Biodiversity Conservation and Humanitarian Support including Organizational Development and GEDSI. It works with a vision for Building a Civilized and Prosperous Society with Equality and Social Justice in Nepal since 2006. It works with a mission to improve the lives of people through economic, social, cultural and physical transformation. It has been implementing Strengthening Disaster Risk Risk Reduction and Climate Resilience Capacities in India and Nepal Project in Mahottari and Dhanusha District in partnership with BMZ/BENGO/Caritas Germany.

Community Development & Advocacy Forum Nepal (CDAFN), Bardibas invites applications from the interested and eligible candidates (Nepali citizen only) who are reliable, accountable, and have the ability to deliver results with the highest level of integrity for the following position under its Strengthening Disaster Risk Risk Reduction and Climate Resilience Capacities in India and Nepal Project.

PHASE Nepal is a not for profit NGO established in 2006 by a group of development professionals dedicated to supporting poor communities in Humla, Bajura, Mugu, Gorkha, Kathmandu, and Sindhupalchok districts of Nepal. For the last 19 years, PHASE Nepal has been improving the livelihoods of rural people by providing immediate support through health care and education services and create opportunities in communities for self-empowerment. Currently, PHASE Nepal’s projects on health, education, and livelihoods are funded by a number of institutional and individual donors from different countries. We also implement various research projects in partnership with different universities from the UK and organizations from other Asian and African countries.

Position: Health Supervisor

Duty Station: Mugu, Bajura and Humla (100% Field Based)

Required Number: Few

Required Qualification and Experience:

  • Should have completed Health Assistant or PCL Staff Nursing Degree with a minimum of 2 years of work experience in a clinical setting, seeing patients, providing nursing care, providing safer motherhood cares, delivery services, newborn care, HMIS recording, reporting, and documentation.
  • Candidates, who have worked with government hospitals, PHC or health posts and supervisory experience in primary health care service in remote community, have received SBA training and having good computer skill will be given priority.

Major Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Ensure that field health projects are managed effectively. Should have good communication and interpersonal skills to demonstrate health education and raise awareness activities in community.
  • Organize/facilitate events for Health Facility Management Committee (HFMC), local stakeholders, teachers, political leaders to strengthen local health service and sustainability
  • Develop a local health program strategy, with particular emphasis on reproductive health and child health
  • Supervise and monitor the work of subordinate staffs
  • Prepare timely and comprehensive reports of all activities to both government and PHASE in standard formats
  • Contribute their work together with the government health workers in the respective health posts or health clinics. This involves both curative as well as preventive health services.
  • Provide health education sessions to the beneficiaries of the catchment area of the health post/clinic
  • Contribute to any task related to the PHASE Nepal program as deemed appropriate by the line manager.
    Maintain and replace drug stock, including government supplies, paying special attention to the safe storage and expiry date of medicines.
  • Arrange for the safe and timely transport of medicines and equipment to the project area
  • Maintain hygiene and infection prevention procedures in the HP and ORC in keeping with PHASE guidelines
  • As required, liaise between project areas and office, and other organizations linked to the health projects

Salary and Benefits per month (NRs.):

Note: Food and Field Allowance may vary depending on the project location.

Benefits:

We also offer Medical Insurance of Rs. 2,25,000/- that covers employee and his/her dependent family members up to two, and Accidental Insurance of Rs. 20,00,000/-.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates who meet the above-mentioned criteria are requested to submit their application by filling the form through the link https://ee-eu.kobotoolbox.org/x/hOZU7b8x no later than 10 January 2026. PHASE reserves the right to qualify/disqualify applications in any case.

We are urgently looking for these positions; therefore, we will close the application if we find appropriate candidates before the application deadline. Therefore, apply as soon as possible if you are interested.

PHASE Nepal is an equal opportunity employer and strictly follows merit-based selection. Suitably qualified local candidates, women, people with disability, and members from disadvantaged communities are strongly encouraged to apply. Only shortlisted candidates will be called for the further selection process.

No telephone inquiries will be entertained, and any inappropriate recommendation will automatically disqualify the candidate from further selection process.

Position: Business Promotion Officer
Location: Kathmandu

Reliance Education Network (REN), established in 1993 AD, is a group of seven educational institutions offering quality education from Pre-primary to Graduate levels in Kathmandu, Nepal. Founded by a team of highly qualified academicians and professionals, REN is committed to academic excellence and holistic development. The network provides comprehensive academic programs at the School Level, +2 Level in Science and Management streams, and Undergraduate programs including BSc. CSIT, BCA, BBA, BBS, and BSW, as well as Graduate programs such as MBA and MBS. With a strong community of over 5,000 students and a dedicated team of 500+ employees, REN continues to shape the future of education through innovation, discipline, and a student-centric approach.

Role Description

The Business Promotion Officer (BPO) at Reliance Education Network is a full-time, on-site role based in Kathmandu. The position is responsible for promoting academic programs, supporting student admissions growth, and strengthening institutional outreach and partnerships.

The BPO will actively engage in field visits, presentations, seminars, and digital promotional activities while coordinating with admissions and academic teams to ensure effective lead management and enrollment conversion.

Qualification and Experience

  • Bachelor’s Degree (Marketing / Business / Management or equivalent)
  •  Minimum 2–3 years of relevant experience in sales, marketing, admissions, or business promotion
  •  Education sector experience is a plus.

Preferable

  • Proven ability to independently handle promotional and outreach activities
  •  Strong public speaking, presentation, and interpersonal skills
  • Target-oriented mindset with the ability to work under pressure
  •  Willingness to travel for field visits, campaigns, and outreach programs
  •  Proficient in computer usage, digital tools, and social media platforms
  •  Basic knowledge of digital marketing (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp & Others)
  •  Ability to build and maintain relationships with schools, parents, and institutions

Scope of Work

  •  Promote academic programs and drive student admissions/enrollment
  •  Conduct field visits, school visits, seminars, presentations, and outreach programs
  •  Support and manage digital promotion campaigns
  • Handle inquiries, lead follow-ups, and counseling coordination
  • Represent the institution at fairs, events, and admission campaigns
  • Build institutional partnerships and referral networks
  • Prepare reports and track promotional performance
  •  Plan and execute promotional sessions and campaigns

Perks & Benefits

  • Competitive Remuneration Package
  • Performance-based incentives
  •  Future Benefits: (PF, Gratuity and CIT)
  •  Insurance Coverage (Medical / Accidental)
  •  Food Facility
  • Focus on Career Growth and Professional Development

Easy Apply or Submit Resume by 5th Jan, 2025

Email To: hr@ren.org.np

CC To: bmehata@ren.org.np

Position: Associate QA Engineer

Job Description

  • Should understand and implement QA processes within SDLC, STLC, and Agile/Scrum methodologies.
  • Responsible for designing, writing, and executing test cases (Manual & Automation) based on functional & non-functional requirements.
  • Perform application testing, including API testing (REST/SOAP) and database validations using SQL queries.
  • Use test automation tools like Selenium, Cypress, Postman, and JUnit to develop and execute scripts.
  • Document defects clearly with reproducible steps and follow through the defect lifecycle using tools like JIRA, Bugzilla, or similar.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Good communication and collaboration with developers, PMs, and stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently and mentor junior QA team members.
    ,

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field
  • Experience: Upto 2 years of hands-on QA & Automation

  • Analyze requirements and create detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts.
  • Identify, document, and track defects with clear reproduction steps.
  • Develop, maintain, and enhance automated test scripts for regression and smoke testing.
  • Perform API testing and validate data integrity

Position: Associate Director, Strategic Information

Location: Kathmandu

This position will be responsible for technical leadership of strategic information, including monitoring, evaluation, reporting, and health information systems across the Meeting Targets and Maintaining Epidemic Control (EpiC) project portfolio. This work currently includes HIV, global health security (GHS), nutrition, maternal, newborn, and child health (MNCH), procurement and supply chain management (PSM), and general health system strengthening support. The Associate Director will lead a team of strategic information experts to ensure the project and the Government of Nepal have strong data management protocols and systems, are using data to inform decision making, and report project results to the United States Government, headquarters, and other stakeholders as required. The Associate Director will work closely with the EpiC Nepal Project Director and other senior project leaders, the United States Department of State, senior government officials, and technical backstops in MNCH, nutrition, procurement, strategic information, and program management to achieve ambitious results quickly.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Oversee two team leads, one in HIV, and the other covering other technical areas, to ensure that these leaders and their staff can meet all project objectives in monitoring and evaluation while working with internal and external focal points to strengthen health information systems.
  • Oversee the work of an expert in health information systems to develop and improve information systems and their use across various platforms, including but not limited to: Maternal Perinatal Death Surveillance and Response (MPDSR) system, Minimum Service Standards (MSS), Public Asset Management (PAMS), and District Health Information System II (DHIS2) tracker, Integrated Health Information Management
  • System (IHIMS), as well as those used to conduct zoonotic disease surveillance.
  • Strengthen the data management and data quality capabilities of dozens of implementing partners, public and private sector health facilities, and the Government of Nepal at all levels.
  • Develop and improve data visualization systems internally, with implementing partners, and with the Government of Nepal.
  • Liaise with government focal points in the Ministry of Health and Population, United States Department of State, subnational government leaders, and other international and national nongovernmental organizations working to advance project objectives and ensure efficient and effective implementation.
  • Manage annual data quality assurance (DQA) activities in alignment with FHI 360 and Government of Nepal standards, develop and ensure implementation of improvement plans.
  • Provide technical assistance for the development, review, and testing of standard operating procedures, quality improvement tools, and job aids.
  • Liaise with FHI 360 experts in all technical areas of implementation and strategic information to ensure technical excellence and alignment with FHI 360’s reporting platforms.
  • Develop Power BI dashboards to visualize project results, train others to understand and use the dashboards in their work. Document project results in presentations and reports.
  • Manage reporting into United States Government management data platforms including Data for Accountability, Transparency and Impact Monitoring (DATIM).
  • Work closely with supervisor, direct reports, and FHI 360 finance and operational teams to ensure the project is delivered on time and on budget.
  • Lead the implementation of quarterly work plans and collaborate with finance teams to ensure accurate budget tracking. Contribute to the preparation of program reports, monthly updates, other necessary technical documents and documentation of successes, lessons learned and good practice.
  • Provide technical expertise in preparation and review of project-related documents.
  • Coordinate with the project’s technical experts to ensure seamless integration of data systems within and across project activities.
  • Serve as a member of the FHI 360 Nepal Senior Leadership Team and provide input and assistance to the management of the country program, develop country program strategy, business plans, operational plans and budgets.
  • Ability to travel 20-30% outside Kathmandu.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by FHI 360 Country Representative/EpiC Nepal Project Director and/or other supervisors.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Master’s degree in statistics, public health, behavioral and social sciences, or a related field with five years of leadership experience in strategic information for public health programs, or a bachelor’s degree with over eight years of experience as mentioned.
  • Experience contributing to national and subnational standards in data management in health (ideally in HIV, nutrition, GHS, and/or MNCH) with a history building the capacity of others.
  • Ability to communicate and coordinate with stakeholders.
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively in an international environment.
  • Strong coordination, communication, and interpersonal aptitudes.
  • Proactive at managing multiple tasks, supervising others, and working in the virtual work environment, must be open to managing time for working with teams in different time zones as needed.
  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication, team building and management, and problem-solving skills.
  • Advanced skills in Excel, Power BI, data visualization, and PowerPoint required, additional expertise in coding and/or the use of statistical software preferred.
  • Ability to use various computer and communication platforms in a professional environment. Experience using Microsoft Office coordination tools (Teams, Outlook, SharePoint, etc.) an advantage.
  • Excellent oral and written English and Nepali including documentation skills.
  • This position is applicable to Nepali citizens only.

The final deadline for application is 5:00 p.m. January 4, 2026.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited for written tests and oral interviews. FHI 360 reserves the right to reject any or all applications received without explanation

Position: Technical Advisor, Global Health Security
Location: Kathmandu, Nepal

This position will be responsible for the management of all global health security (GHS) activities under the EpiC portfolio, which primarily focuses on strengthening the Government of Nepal’s ability to prevent, detect and respond to zoonotic disease outbreaks through cross sectoral collaboration at the national and sub-national level. The Technical Advisor will be required to implement ambitious work plan to improve GHS in partnership with the Epidemiology and Disease Control Division (EDCD), Department of Health Services (DoHS), Ministry of Health and Population (MOHP), and Department of Livestock Services (DLS), Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development (MOALD). The Technical Advisor will work closely with the EpiC Nepal Project Director, United States Department of State-funded Strengthening Infectious Disease Detection System (STRIDES) team and the United States Department of State, government officials, and EpiC technical backstops in GHS, strategic information, and program management to achieve an ambitious set of results quickly. This position is based in Kathmandu with frequent field visits (up to 30%) in different parts of Nepal.

Key Responsibilities

  • Oversee all technical elements of the GHS project including working closely with the government counterparts including EDCD/DoHS/MOHP, DLS/MOALD, and other respective departments, divisions and centres as well as and other key stakeholders to advance project objectives.
  • Provide technical assistance for development, review and testing of contingency plans, standard operating procedures, clinical protocols, joint risk-based surveillance assessment and surveillance plan for zoonotic diseases.
  • Develop and improve simulation exercises to support national and subnational preparedness to respond to zoonotic disease outbreaks.
  • Provide technical assistance to collect, assemble, and review data related to zoonotic disease outbreaks.
  • Provide technical assistance to develop on job training materials on good husbandry practices, farm biosecurity, rational use of antibiotics/drugs, early recognition of notifiable zoonotic diseases, and priority zoonotic diseases.
  • Liaise with animal health sector to identify various commodities and drugs required to manage disease outbreaks and epidemics, and support to provide the commodities and drugs as a gap filling measure.
  • Facilitate table talks/after action reviews on simulation exercises and emergency responses.
  • Engage with multisectoral government structures to ensure strong coordination and facilitate the expansion and operationalization of Federal One Health Action Plan to provinces and districts.
  • Liaise with FHI 360 experts in GHS, strategic information, private sector engagement, and more to ensure technical excellence.
  • Work closely with local, regional, and headquarters-based staff to ensure the project is delivered on time and on budget.
  • Lead the implementation of quarterly and annual work plans and collaborate with finance teams to ensure accurate budget tracking. Contribute to the preparation of program reports, monthly updates, other necessary technical and programmatic documents and documentation of success, lessons learned and good practice.
  • Provide technical expertise in preparation and review of project related documents.
  • Coordinate and collaborate with technical, strategic information and M&E staff for strengthening One Health approach and strategy.
  • Serve as the primary focal point for EpiC Nepal with the United States Department of State on all elements GHS program within EpiC.
  • Ensure alignment between EpiC GHS work and other FHI 360 projects focused on GHS.
  • Any other tasks assigned by the supervisor or Country Representative.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in public health or other relevant subject with 8 years of experience in animal health/One Health, or a related area or Masters’ degree with 5 years of similar experience is considered equivalent.
  • Experience in zoonotic diseases, animal husbandry, biosafety and biosecurity and how to apply principles, experiencing building the capacity of others on these topics preferred.
  • Experience managing small donor-funded projects, ideally with funding from the United States Government.
  • Experience working with MoHP, MoALD and their respective departments, divisions and centers is desirable.
  • Ability to communicate and coordinate with multi-sectoral stakeholders, with strong coordination, communication, and interpersonal aptitudes.
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively in an IT environment.
  • This role requires flexibility for domestic travel, up to 30% of the time.
  • Ability to work independently to meet ambitious deliverables while collaboratively engaging other technical experts to supplement expertise.
  • Proactive in managing multiple tasks and flexible and open to managing time for working with different teams in different time zones as needed.
  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication, team building and management, and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent oral and written English and Nepali including documentation skills.

Eligibility: Only Nepali citizens are eligible to apply.

The final deadline for application is 5:00 p.m. January 4, 2026.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited for written tests and oral interviews. FHI 360 reserves the right to reject any or all applications received without explanation.

Position: Technical Director, Maternal, Newborn, and Child Health (MNCH)
Location: Kathmandu, Nepal

The Technical Director, MNCH is responsible for providing leadership and oversight for activities in MNCH under the Meeting Targets and Maintaining Epidemic Control (EpiC) project in Nepal.. The Technical Director will be required to implement ambitious work plans to improve MNCH outcomes in Karnali, Lumbini, and Sudurpaschim provinces in partnership with the Ministry of Health and Population (MOHP), especially the Family Welfare Division (FWD), Department of Health Services (DoHS) as well as subnational government authorities. The Technical Director will contribute to the design of interventions, work alongside the government, project staff, and local implementing partners to ensure technical excellence. The individual in this role will collaborate with other team members to ensure the provision of life-saving commodities and equipment align with on-the-ground needs and contribute to monitoring, evaluation, research, and learning activities. The Technical Director will work closely with the EpiC Nepal Project Director, Technical Director, Nutrition, and other senior project leaders, the United States Department of State, FWD/DoHS officials, and EpiC technical backstops in MNCH strategic information, and program management to achieve an ambitious set of results quickly.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the overall implementation of MNCH interventions.
  • Provide technical oversight and support to a team of technical specialists in MNCH, private sector engagement, and more.
  • Manage a project with ambitious timelines while ensuring sustainable, high-quality interventions.
  • Develop and oversee key strategic partnerships with FWD/DoHS and subnational government authorities, the United States Government, other international organizations working in MNCH, and local implementing partners.
  • Liaise with FHI 360 experts in MNCH, strategic information, private sector engagement, and more to ensure technical excellence.
  • Work closely with local, regional, and headquarters-based staff to ensure the project is delivered on time and on budget.
  • Lead the implementation and monitoring of annual work plans and collaborate with finance teams to ensure accurate budget tracking. Contribute to the preparation of program reports, monthly updates, other necessary technical and programmatic documents and documentation of successes, lessons learned and good practice.
  • Serve as the primary focal point for EpiC Nepal with the United States Department of State on all elements of the MNCH program.
  • Provide line management to three team members and supplementary management to their reports including fostering a team environment that can deliver results.
  • Represent FHI 360 in external functions at international, national, and subnational events for MNCH -related activities.
  • Serve as a member of the Nepal Senior Leadership Team and provide input and assistance to the country office and program management and operations as well as business development activities.
  • Coordinate with other EpiC senior leaders including the Associate Director for Strategic Information, Senior Project Manager, Deputy Project Director, HIV, and Technical Director, Procurement and Supply Chain
  • Management to ensure strategic alignment and efficient use of resources (financial, human, and relational) across the project.
  • Perform other duties as assigned by FHI 360 Country Representative/EpiC Nepal Project Director and/or other supervisors.

Requirements

  • Master’s degree in public health, behavioral and social sciences, or a related field with five to seven years of experience in managing MNCH-focused public health programs or a bachelor’s degree with over seven years of experience as mentioned.
  • Experience and understanding of the national MNCH components and implementation requirements including critical, life-saving technical approaches,
  • Understanding and experience working alongside the Government of Nepal to implement health programming.
  • Experience working in an international non-governmental organization managing diverse teams to implement public health programs focused on MNCH.
  • Experience establishing and maintaining positive working relationships and partnerships with partners and major stakeholders.
  • Experience overseeing all aspects of projects, preferably large donor-funded, including program and financial management, human resources, compliance, and quality assurance.
  • Experience guiding program, technical, financial and administrative teams to complete objectives/activities on time and within budget while meeting high quality standards.
  • Proactive in managing multiple tasks, managing and working in the virtual work environment, and flexible and open to managing time working with different teams in different time zones as needed.
  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication, coordination and collaboration, team building and management, and problem-solving skills.
  • Experience using Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, Outlook, SharePoint, etc.) an advantage.
  • Excellent oral and written English and Nepali including documentation skills.

Eligibility: Only Nepali citizens are eligible to apply.

The final deadline for application is 5:00 p.m. January 4, 2026.

Only short-listed candidates will be invited for written tests and oral interviews. FHI 360 reserves the right to reject any or all applications received without explanation.
